campaign.story:
WE ARE FUNDED - THANK YOU! 
Want to get updates on development? Subscribe to our newsletter!
Want to Wishlist the game on Steam? Do that here!
You can also Follow us on Twitter or join our Discord.

ABOUT THE GAME
Whisker Squadron is our fresh take on forward scrolling aerial combat, featuring feline heroes, dynamic missions, and procedurally generated bosses and worlds!
Coming to PC and consoles in 2022
 Wishlist on Steam | Website | Twitter | Facebook | 

Hey everyone! 
We are Flippfly, the team behind 2013's Race The Sun. We are so excited to let you know about our new project, Whisker Squadron!
Click banner to wishlist Whisker Squadron right now!
Whisker Squadron is the culmination of a creative spark that was lit over 20 years ago, and that has burned in us through our careers, and strengthened by modern indie games. When we created Race The Sun in 2013, we took aesthetic cues from classic low-poly games like Star Fox for the Super Nintendo, and created something with a uniquely minimalist feeling that was loved by our fans. Ever since that project shipped, we’ve talked about creating a follow up that was more combat-focused, and that pushed the procedurally-generated elements even further.

Whisker Squadron is that game.

Choose your pilot and fight your way through procedurally-generated worlds and epic, procedurally-generated boss fights. You've got one life, and your tactical upgrade choices will be crucial to your success in this aerial roguelike.

Engage in epic aerial combat with your feline pilot of choice
Take on a series of epic, procedurally-generated boss fights
Fight your way through dynamic worlds in a mission that's unique every time you play it
And there's more:
Procedurally generated, rogue-like mission structure that's unique every time you play
Incredibly dynamic procedurally-generated bosses that make for intense climax to every act
Choose your pilots from a cast of 3 feline heroes
Daily challenges and leaderboards
Don't just take our word for it! Here is what the games press is saying about Whisker Squadron:
“Some of the bosses look downright inspired” - PC Gamer 
“If this is where the game is starting in the public eye, I can’t wait to see where it ends up.” - Polygon 
“It's early days yet, but yeah, I'd play this” - Rock Paper Shotgun 
“While on the surface Whisker Squadron looks like Starfox with cats, the addition of Race the Sun’s elements make it a very different game.” - Hardcore Gamer 
“The foundation of a tried and true rail shooter mixed with procedurally-generated level design, roguelike gameplay, and striking art design is a solid one for Flippfly.” - Shacknews 
Whisker Squadron is a corridor shooter with procedurally generated worlds, some light roguelike elements, and a cast of cats! Pilot your ship, avoiding obstacles and blasting the autonomous bots built by the sinister PAW Technologies corporation in an effort to save the galaxy from out of control algorithms bent on planetary destruction.

The game follows an action rogue-like formula: You get a single life to play through a 3-act campaign through several worlds and random space encounters, each with their own looks and threats. Challenge yourself to acquire higher rankings by avoiding damage, blasting all the bots, and keeping your multiplier high to earn the most rewards for beating each world.
Challenge isn't everything, so we also offer a set of customizable gameplay settings instead of traditional difficulty settings. Start with more shields on your ship? Encounter less enemies? Get health pickups at the end of each world? Go for it!
And if you want a nightmare, the settings will be there for you masochist-cats as well...mewhahaha
Dynamic mission map

Play as multiple characters, each with their own unique special weapon. Along the way you'll encounter shops and events to acquire a choice of new weapons and items to powerup as you make your way across the galaxy to stop the bots. Each play-through is unique, with each world being procedurally generated from a set of 'pattern' chunks, and a map that presents different connections and choices.
And it's not just the worlds which are generated: each act culminates with an epic battle against a large enemy bot, and the bots are always looking for improvements so you'll have to keep on your toes each play-through because this bot is procedurally generated for a unique battle each time!
Jin is our character artist, and has drawn our wonderful cast of cats. Here's a few of them:
Sean is leading the way on the visual development for the game, using the custom world editor that we’ve built for this game. We’re evolving the minimalist style we developed with Race The Sun, and adding layers of visual flair on top. What you see on this Kickstarter page is a work-in-progress. We’re improving the visuals more every week, and we’re confident that the final look will blow you away.
We’re also super excited to be working with Chel Wong on the game’s original soundtrack. Chel has an amazing range of styles and really nailed the feeling that we’re going for with this game. You can hear her work in the trailer above!

Here’s what Chel has to say about working on the Soundtrack:
“For the soundtrack I have so many ideas I'm excited to work on! I plan on taking some influence from predecessors in the genre but also going to be putting my own spin on things. And as is my specialty, I can't wait to see what kind of adaptive layers I can put into this soundtrack to react to gameplay!

SOUNDTRACK PREVIEW
here's a little preview of what Chel's cooking up for the soundtrack. This is the track for Lunar Canyon, along with the "boss variant" that will play at the end level boss fight.
(Note: this is a work-in progress, Chel is still in the process of adding some sweet guitars!)
Here are a few of the more unique Kickstarter-exclusive rewards we're offering!

PUT YOURSELF IN THE GAME ($200 and above)
You'll send us a photo of yourself, your pet or anything that's age-appropriate, and we'll add it to an object in a special "Easter egg" level that players can access in the game itself!
Put yourself in the secret level, rough concept
ADD YOUR FURRY FRIEND ($500 and above) 
You'll send us a picture of your pet, or some artwork of your personal animal persona, and we'll add it to the game as a secret playable character, unlocked with a unique cheat code.
Your furry friend in the game, rough concept
CUSTOM SHOUT OUT $1000 and above)
We'll send you a survey and code up a special conversation with the characters in the game, who will give you a shout-out by name, activated by a special personal cheat code. We'll work with you to make it special!
Custom shout-out, rough concept
Aaron San Filippo is a co-founder of Flippfly and the company’s lead programmer. He’s overseeing production and code, building new tools to support the design of the game, and coordinating the team. He also built the prototype for the game and helps out with design.

Sean Campbell is the designer and creative director. Sean helped Flippfly build Race The Sun’s portal worlds, and has returned as the world creator and Whisker Squadron’s creative director. He’s also leading the efforts on the game’s 3D art. 
Aaron, Sean, Chel, Jin, Chris, and Zaire

Chel Wong is a seasoned composer with multiple game soundtracks to her name. Chel works in a variety of styles with an incredible range, and she’s creating an awesome original soundtrack for Whisker Squadron.

Chris Atkins joined Flippfly recently as a programmer, and is helping flesh out Whisker Squadron’s gameplay.

Jin Li is a concept artist and animator from Sydney, Australia. She created and drew all of the characters for Whisker Squadron and contributed concept design.

Zaire Lanier is a writer and narrative designer from the Midwestern US. She's creating a comic called The Bone Herder, and will be helping create the WS universe, characters, and in-game dialog.
June 2021: beta-level backers and above get early access to the beta on PC
December 2021: game is content-complete and enters final phase of testing
May 2022: The game launches and all backers get a PC copy
July 2022: All physical and digital rewards are delivered.
Most of the funding for Whisker Squadron comes directly from Flippfly. We have been working on this game for about a year, and we are in a fortunate situation where Race The Sun and our other games are providing a steady income stream that’s allowed us to work on the game. However, this Kickstarter will be essential for getting us over the finish line, and if we reach our stretch goals, will allow us to create an even better game, and guarantee an on-time delivery.

We’ve invested a lot of Flippfly funds in Whisker Squadron already, supporting a small core team to build about 1/3rd of the game so far. We are on Kickstarter to raise funds to help finish the game and expand our team. This money will help us create an original soundtrack, add additional features, and finish the game sooner.
Your support means the world to us! Our fans have always been central to Flippfly’s success, and you are quite literally making this project possible. Thanks for coming along for the ride and being a part of our dream project!

* Platforms:
At this time, we are planning for Steam, Epic Games Store on PC. We're also looking into PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch We will finalize these plans in the coming months and keep you updated! Backers will get a key on their choice of PC stores. 

We are planning on supporting Windows, Mac, and Linux on PC.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Running a videogame business always carries a certain amount of risk. We're creating a unique new product, and there's a possibility some elements won't work out the way we planned.

However, Flippfly has shipped 4 full titles across half a dozen platforms, and we feel confident that we'll be able to deliver on this project as-promised and on time!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hello! Maybe this is the first time you hear about Rogue Fang or maybe you already know about us and are back for more. In any case, let us introduce ourselves! We are Rogue Fang The Furry Underwear Brand.  Last year, we successfully launched our brand thanks to the support of more than 590 sponsors who helped us not only to fulfill our dream but to go beyond our wildest expectations!!
During our first year, we have shipped many orders around the world, and we have grown thanks to the support of thousands of people who believe in us and who have given us their feedback to help make our brand even better.
We are back once more to ask for your support to turn our latest and biggest endeavor yet into another Rogue Fang success story: We are of course talking about our new line of sexy trunks and boxer briefs!
Ready? Let's go!
The Deer
This is "The Deer", it gathers the design fundamentals of our jockstrap from the same name. Elegant, refined, and playful. "The Deer" is made to enhance your curves while providing comfort. Colors: Light blue and black.
The Wolf
Here is the sturdy one—"The Wolf", being in yellow and black, and like the Jockstrap version, it has a faux pocket in the pouch that adds extra comfort even in the heaviest situations. Colors: Yellow and black.
The Behemoth
Finally, we have “The Behemoth” featuring a straight cut both in shape and design and with a punch of lime and black colors that is sure to stand out as the highlight of any underwear collection! Colors: Lime (Green) and black.
We have decided to return to Kickstarter to finance our new line because we are still a small brand with limited resources, unlike other large fashion companies, we cannot run the risk of creating a new line with the large outlay that this entails.
However, thanks to the experience gained from the first campaign, we have been able to pinpoint the requirements to take the project to the shore safely. The minimum we must reach on this occasion is 18,000€. Because we already have logistics and partners that help us, we have been able to opt for better prices and quality.
If we exceed the 18,000€ goal, we will be on our way to unlock better rewards and stretch goals! We have very special things waiting, we just need your support.
Stretch goals unlock items included in the selected rewards and are granted if the goals are met, in that case, you're receiving goodies at no extra cost!. Check them below! 
25K€ First Stretch Goal: Rogue Fang Lanyard

38K€ Second stretch Goal: The Dragon 🐲 (EXCLUSIVE to ALL-IN backers)
We started at the beginning of this year to work on the designs of our underwear since they were in high demand from the very beginning. With the designs already polished and with the samples reviewed and approved, we have only minor adjustments left before sending them to production.
First of all, these estimates are subject to change since, as you know, the world is fighting against a global pandemic that affects many areas such as production and logistics.
Straight to the point, the project needs at least one month to funded, around 2 months for production with  +/- 30 days of shipping to our warehouse. That makes around 3 months of work, so we will be ready to make the first shipments in February 2021.
This time we will ship the items despite your geographical location, whether it reaches you sooner or later depends exclusively on how quickly you answer the form 😊
Thanks to our experience acquired during this year of activity, we have access to better shipping prices and greater control over the particularities of each country in terms of shipments.
Please allow me to talk personally as I want to thank WhiteLeonard for his hard work doing those awesome artworks and helping with designs, logos, etc. His help is invaluable and thanks to this Rogue Fang keeps progressing.
I also want to thank all the people who have helped Rogue Fang to improve through their feedback and to those who posted photos and videos excited to receive their order. 
Last but not least, I want to thank my friends (and you know who you are!) as they have helped me lots when it was needed. Special thanks to Kyo, Alberto & Pedro.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Covid-19
This campaign will undoubtedly be marked by the global pandemic of Covid-19 since it can directly affect the supply of materials, production, transport ... However, we believe that the production and transport process of our product can endure without problems a moderate rebound, although anything can happen.

Situations beyond our control
Apart from the pandemic, problems may arise that delay our production, although scarce, it is a possibility.

Shortage
Covid-19 has reduced the production of material and this could be a risk factor if the pandemic worsens globally.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
Our philosophy is to use materials that are easy to recycle and that have more than one use, for example, the packaging of our product is made of cardboard and is designed to be attractive so that you can use it as a decoration object in your room if you wish! :)
Sustainable Distribution
We work with companies committed to the environment, both DHL Express and UPS use recyclable materials in their packaging in addition to CO2 compensations for the transport of the product.

On March 31, 2021, the United Kingdom has implemented the new trade policies, these policies establish a series of requirements that all European businesses, large or small, must adopt to export goods into the UK. updates.update_userinfo: Fresh Updates! Production finished by the end of March
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! We bring interesting news to start the month of March, we already have updates on the production of the briefs, stickers, and the new boxes. Let us begin! :)
Briefs: Production status
Our supplier has notified us that production has started and is estimated to be completed in the last days of March. We are super excited to see how it turned out. Of course, the goods must be transported, depending on whether it is feasible to opt for air or sea transport,
Stickers: Production status

Hey!
We are back to update you about the recent news regarding the status of this campaign. We set our delivery date for February 2021, yet we must face a delay of one or two months from the original delivery date. It sets the new date of delivery in late March or April.
We have considered ways to avoid this delay (including working with a new supplier), but the solutions were scarce and way out of the resources allocated for this campaign. The world pandemic slowed down the production of the samples and details of the new collection before production.

Happy Holidays! We are by the end of the year, a year that has been really tough we are pulling through, but it is time to hope for a better year to come in 2021.

We have juicy updates, starting with the Lanyards, as we have received them less than a month ago. After reviewing them, we can only say that they look excellent! Here are some photos <3

We are back with our 7th update! With over 95% of the forms filled, we are moving towards the next stage as we already have sent the definitive blueprints to our supplier to begin the production right away!
From the end of the campaign to the day of today, we have been working on the very last details before sending the blueprints. For instance, we checked the durability of the epoxy badges to make sure they would either fit or not our standards. We chose knitted logos on the back with confidence, as epoxy badges did not pass our tests.

Good evening!

We have received the report that the form for "All-In" rewards was limited in the number of answers it could receive. We have fixed this issue, you can send the form as usual. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Many online clothing stores you see these days operate on a print-to-order basis. 

What does that mean? That means that you can slap a design on to their website and put it up for sale right away. No start up costs and no planning whatsoever. It also means you don't get to assure the quality of your product, nor your print. It means you have no idea who made your clothes nor the conditions in which they are manufactured. It means you are likely sending out products to customers with your design on it that are poor quality and badly made. It means you're limited to making whatever they are capable of printing on.

At Nomad Complex, we don't do that. We refuse it. 

Every piece of clothing we put out passes through our hands from start to finish. From the concept of the design, to its creation, to the materials used to create our garments, to sampling what the final product will be before it goes out to a customer, to packing and shipping everything ourselves. This way, we know what quality of merchandise you're getting because we've been in charge of it - Every step of the way. 

This process foregoes the ease and low setup cost that comes with print to order, however, and to create these quality clothes we turn to Kickstarter to procure the funds to do so. You couldn't have clothes of this quality created on a print to order website - Or at all. 

We've already sampled the products. We've done the testing. We've put them through the wash 60 times to ensure the colors won't fade. Now it's time to get them into your hands.

Say NO to cheap quick clothes. Say YES to quality clothes that'll last you for years.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We have tested dozens of material samples and stitching techniques in order to ensure a long-lasting quality in all of our loungewear. Digital sublimation printing ensures a long-lasting print that can stand dozens of washes as well as take heat well in the dryer. We continue our commitment to quality assurance at every step and refuse to ever resort to dropship fulfillment services for our products - Every product you receive is inspected, packed and shipped by our own staff, not a third party.
Reusability and recyclability
All of our clothing is designed to be your new favorite piece. We reject the idea of fast fashion and outfits you wear only once - We embrace the idea that a piece of clothing is something to be loved, cherished forever, worn to death, stitched back up, and passed on to someone else if you no longer wish to have it. That's our mantra.

All of our packaging is minimal - We do not wrap our clothing in harmful plastics. All of our shipping materials are made from 100% recycled materials.
Sustainable materials
All of our packaging materials are made from 100% recycled content.
Environmentally friendly factories
We have been working with the same manufacturer since we began our company in 2016, and have personally verified the conditions and quality of the area where our clothing is produced. Not only that, but we've even had a hand in running the presses once or twice ourselves.
Sustainable Distribution
Did we mention our motto of loving your clothes until they die? We mean it. Anyone can buy a certain color of a pair of pants, or they can buy cheap clothes that will only last them a few wears before they get thrown away, but ours are different. They'll stand up to everything you throw at them, and they look so good that you'll never want to give them away. That's how we think of clothes, and we hope you do too.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
To help keep problems to a minimum, we have completed the design work and made sure that all potential rewards are ready even before starting the campaign. The team of 5+ people who work for ArtworkTee.com are ready and willing to meet challenges that happen during the production or shipping process. 

We have made our estimates based on approximately 125 shirts sold, and one risk/challenge is if a significantly lower or higher amount is sold. If a significantly lower amount (for example, 25), then we will fulfill rewards via DTG instead of screen printing. If a significantly higher amount is sold, then it may take longer to fulfill the rewards than expected, because of the small size of our team. If that is the case, we will bring on temporary workers and volunteers who can help package and ship the rewards to the donators. Our team is highly skilled and experienced, having experience in inventory management and packaging from many years working at conventions. Whatever challenges arise, we will be able to overcome them.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Muffin Time is a chaotic card game with more twists and turns than you can shake a spork at! Battle your friends, family, and hyper-intelligent pets by drawing and playing from a deck of unique cards that’ll either help you, thwart others, or mix things up for the sheer hell of it! To win the game, you just need to start your turn with exactly 10 cards in you hand but if you think that’ll be easy, you’re wrong (wronger than a duck wearing shoes – and that’s pretty damn wrong).
asdfmovie, created by Thomas 'TomSka' Ridgewell, has been making people giggle and guffaw for over a decade and now that high-energy randomness has escaped the small screen and invaded your game night. 
So, if you're looking for a hilarious and unpredictable game, I hear Cards Against Humanity is pretty fun! But since you probably own that already, maybe give Muffin Time a chance. 
Thank you, have fun, and watch out for skateboarding cows.
- Tom, Elliot, Eddie, and the Big Potato Team

updates.update_userinfo: FINAL BOARDING CALL FOR MUFFIN TIME AIRLINES
updates.update_content:
You know what’s even worse than missing your flight? Missing out on a lovely little party game that you backed on Kickstarter.

According to our calculations, lots and lots of you should have received your copy of Muffin Time by now. However, there are still a few backers who’s details are missing — and if we don’t have your details, we can’t send you your game!

So, if you haven’t been in touch with us about getting your game (or any replacement cards), you absolutely MUST let us know asap via Kickstarter message. The window for this closes on March 1st and once it’s shut, we just can’t open it.

updates.update_userinfo: Boosters engaged — they’re on their way…
updates.update_content:
Have you had a recent encounter with some horrible, oversized cards that were supposed to fit neatly into your otherwise-wonderful game?
If so, then don’t worry. As you read this, a solution is speeding across the ocean on a boat filled with Muffin Time Cards.
If you filled out the replacement form before November: Well done on being so organised, we were able to get you on the list to be sent directly from China. As soon as your booster packs leave the boat, they’ll be sent straight to your letterbox.

If you’ve been burdened with giant cards (sorry again about that), then you’ll want to read the next bits below. If all your cards are normal, please scroll down to the bottom for some fun things.
We’ve talked it over with the factory and it looks like the replacement cards should all be ready by the end of this month. After that, they’ll be sent out to everyone direct from China. The exact delivery date will depend on where you live, but either way, you should have your new cards by Christmas — no matter where you are.

It’s come to our attention that a couple of Muffin Times have been invaded by (slightly) giant, smooth cards. We’re here to stop them from ruining the fun. Thanks to an annoying problem at the factory, the Kickstarter and Booster Cards in some of the packs have been printed on cards that are a different size and texture to the rest of the game. This makes them stick out from the rest of the deck in a very unsatisfying way. As irritating as these giant cards are, don’t worry — we can fix it.

updates.update_userinfo: A SPECIAL UPDATE FOR USA, CANADA AND MEXICO
updates.update_content:
Last time we spoke, we told you everything our fulfilment company told us. Unfortunately, it looks things haven’t really gone to plan. Although all the games are currently being shipped out and have begun arriving, it looks like some of the deliveries are taking more time than they originally thought.
We’re just as annoyed as you, but this isn’t us trying to pass the blame either. We’re really sorry for the extra delay and the misinformation — we’re doing our best to get to the bottom of it.

According to our scanners, a lot of backers have already received their muffins in the mail (which is great). However, we know that a lot of you are still waiting (which is not so great).
So, without further ado, here’s a bunch of different updates to read through:

If you live in the USA, Canada or Mexico
UPS are on the case and will be dispatching your games (with tracking) by the end of this week.
Unfortunately, we can no longer update your delivery address for you, so if you need to make adjustments, you’ll have to chat to UPS yourself.

If UPS tell you the game has been delivered back to us, ping us a message on Kickstarter instead and we’ll investigate. Don't worry, your games will not be gone forever, we'll make sure you get your copy.



Your games are on the way! Due to a mix up with our shipping company in China, it looks like the tracking info was never sent to backers, but rest assured — they’ll be with you soon.

The good news is, the shipping company sent us a very very big database that’s filled with everyone’s tracking details instead. So, if you’re desperate for an update, get in touch and we can look up the status of your order.

updates.update_userinfo: YOU HAVE QUESTIONS, WE HAVE ANSWERS
updates.update_content:
People are starting to receive their games and that’s all very exciting, but what about the poor souls who HAVEN’T received their game yet? Worry not, because we’ve got all the info you need below:
Q: What’s happening?!?
   A: The games are currently starting to arrive with backers across Europe. If that’s where you live and you haven’t received yours yet, just sit tight and relax because Tim is handling everything.

updates.update_userinfo: Coming soon to a front door near you!
updates.update_content:
We’re very, very happy to announce that the massive containers have been locked and loaded — but not in that order. 
All of the copies of Muffin Time have left the factory and are now jetting their way across the ocean. However, thanks to some shipping routes being a little more difficult than others, the arrival times are a bit staggered:
IF YOU LIVE IN AMERICA & CANADA: The games should be arriving with the American couriers by end of July. Tracking info should be with you shortly afterwards.

updates.update_userinfo: Anyone got any spare shipping containers?
updates.update_content:
We’re afraid that the games have been delayed once again. This means you most likely won’t receive them until late June / early July.
As you can probably guess, this is because of the deadly virus floating around the world, and all the annoying effects it keeps having on all our lives. Of course, delaying a batch of Muffin Games isn’t the worst part of it, but it’s a bummer nonetheless.
Although the games are made, it’s taking longer than we thought for them to be sorted at the factory. This is largely due to a shortage of shipping containers available, due to high demand. Next, they’ll be sent out to different countries for processing, then tracking info will be provided for every single game, which should be in your inbox by the 3rd or 4th week of June.

updates.update_userinfo: The Muffin is ready to launch
updates.update_content:
The big moment has almost arrived. We’re ready to push the button and send off 25,000 copies of Muffin Time to all four corners of the world.
For dramatic effect, we’ll be hovering our fingers over the button to start the process for the next few days. This means that you have 5 DAYS to make sure your delivery address is absolutely 100% accurate. Once we’ve pushed the button, it can’t be un-pushed.

campaign.story:
*******************************************
$30,000 STRETCH GOAL!!!
One pledger will win, via drawing, a Dick Valentine 
penned short story, once we hit the $30,000 mark.
********************************************
$22,500 STRETCH GOAL HAS BEEN REACHED !!!
We hit the number,  so the Bite Me set will include two extra songs, demos which were created but never finished, intended for a proposed Season 3 of Bite Me which never came to be.
********************************************
Several years ago, Dick Valentine was asked to contribute songs for the soundtrack of a video horror series entitled "Bite Me."  Those songs have been unavailable as stand alone music...until now.  We're extremely excited to make the soundtracks of BIte Me! Seasons One and Two available via this limited edition Kickstarter campaign.  The tracks are as follows:
Season  1 (produced by William Bates)
Detroit Sandwich
 The Night Makes a Stain
 Teachable Moment 
Back to the Yard with Drac 
Zombie Zombie Skeleton 
Season 2 (recorded by Emmet  Farley)        The Eye Your Mother Warned You  About
 Two Kinds of Monsters 
The Sad Little Planet that Was
 I Don't Like to Howl (At  Midnight) 
Extreme Demons 
The Line Dividing Your Fantasy
 Tonight's the New Black Hole 
Point of Entry
 Wild Son of the Stratosphere
 When I Hear The Sound
This release is limited to this Kickstarter campaign.  We won't be issuing "Bite Me" in any other form, so it's a one shot deal.  Please note that all pledgers for physical copies of the Bite Me CD will also receive a digital download version as well.
In  addition to the CD, we're making a wide variety of great packages available to pledgers to get a fuller, richer, deeper Dick Valentine experience. Ever had a desire to perform live with Dick? You can do that now.  Want him to draw your portrait, to render you as you REALLY are? That can happen.  Check out the wide variety of packages on offer. Electric Six has concluded its Kickstarter offerings but  you have a chance to get back in the game one more time via DV's "Bite Me" campaign.  Don't miss out! 
Please Note: many of the reward packages in this campaign can be fulfilled in conjunction with Electric Six touring, such as dinners, tarot readings, etc. If you have questions, please contact us for further details.

#SallyTheSeries  
IMPORTANT LINKS:
TWITTER |  FACEBOOK |  YOUTUBE |  INSTAGRAM 
SALLY is a psychological, satire, thriller drama based in a world populated by anthropomorphic characters, more commonly known as “Furries”.
The first season takes place in London where a young teenage wolf named CODY gets swept up in trouble for a crime he didn't commit. The first season is only 3 episodes long and revealed the season's main world idea:
NOTHING IS REAL.
Sally is a 6 year old girl, with quite a twisted mind, making up all the stories in the show.
But why?
In season 2, we will recieve a closer look into Sally and her imagination together with a new extended cast! 
Watch season 1 of Sally HERE.
SALLY started as part of our student university project. The original plan was to create a three part web drama and run this across various social media platforms. 
However, the show garnered an overwhelming amount of love and support.
The production team had little idea how the pilot would be received, but in the six weeks after its premiere on YouTube, the show gathered an astounding amount of attention; ranging from numerous comments, fan-art, and support for the show as well as wholehearted demands for more episodes. 
So now, we're raising money to continue the show. 
We care about this show so much, simply because it is something we always dreamt of: Being able to create fun content online for an audience.  We had no idea what would come of it but over the past few months we watched the show and its fanbase blossom. 
As this was a university project it was scheduled to be completed at the end of March 2019, and us then completely move on to a new project in April. 
BUT we don't want to end this series as we have a lot more ideas where to take the show and would love to continue making more episodes. However, the show costs a lot to produce so we need your help to continue it and to evolve the show into something that truly will make a positive impact on the fandom! 
The next season will have a way greater production value than before. A new team, new skilled volunteers, and restriction-free storytelling!
SECOND ATTEMPT!
This is our 2nd attempt at raising funds!
Originally we planned to raise £12,000 to hire those who would be leaving university right now and would be looking for work. Unfortunately we failed in our attempts to do that.
But we're not the ones to give up just yet! Instead, we now gathered a small team of people to create the show as a voluntary passion project. All the money we raise will go towards travels, accommodation and food for everyone helping to make this show! Any additional money will go into future episodes and creating merchandise!
You can check our first kickstarter here.
OUR TEAM:
Who would've thought: we're a group of passionate Furries. Initially, we started out with 6 people. After the student project 3 of us stayed together to continue the show. Though we receive help from you guys and people we know in the film world, be it through volunteers, equipment or funding! :)
Chantelle/Yoka - Creator and Manager
A Fursuit Maker who has been on YouTube for many years and always wanted to create a successful show starring a diverse range of characters. One of her favourite shows is Bojack Horseman and her favorite company is Pixar.
Em - Producer and Writer
As an aspiring producer and writer, it has always been a passion of hers to write and create shows that are unique and quirky within the horror/thriller genre.
Carlos - Director, Photography and Content Production
A photographer and content creator aspiring to one day become a film director. He sees this series as a chance to make his mark in the industry, assisting in his pursuit of a prosperous career in film making. With a load of ideas for sub-arcs and stories for the series, the future for the show looks exciting!
Finn/TraaaashPanda - Graphics Designer and Social Media Manager
A german hobby Graphics Designer and aspiring Content Manager. Voluntarily joining the team because of his passion for creation and Furries, as well as adding a good project on his portfolio for his future career in the online content management branch.
PLAN BREAKDOWN AND MILESTONES
 21st June: Kickstarter goes live.
 5th July: Kickstarter ends.
 20th July: Cast confirmed, team confirmed, script finished. 
 21st July - 7th September: Shootings days to film all of season 2. 
 8th September - 12th October: Post Production.
 23rd - 27th October: MCM Week end, release of season 2.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
People dropping out - Even though we have a strong team, there is always a risk for someone to drop out. However we have good connections in place to hire new people if this were to happen.

Equipment - this can be a possible challenge as well. We will be using the equipment that we can access while we are at University, meaning there is always a risk of us not being able to book the equipment out in case someone has booked it already. In cases like these, we try make sure that we use either our own equipment or look on hire websites so we can externally hire our equipment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We have now officially finished sending out all of the rewards! If you have not received your reward, please let us know! You can keep up to date with us on twitter @SallyTheSeries  Thank you again to all who supported us in making the show! 
Editing is now under way. (We apologize to the couple of people who got confused along the way! In that the funding we received was to help us make the show in terms of filming only. ) Editing in it's self is a whole other story, work, time and talent. Episode 1 was aired as promised back in October 2019! Episode 2 is scheduled to be out end of July 2020. And we hope to bring out a new episode every month.

Thank you all so much! We reached the goal we set for this kick-starter!

Originally, we wanted to pay a crew and worked out that £12,000 was the budget we needed to cover all of our costs. Our first kick-starter ended with us raising around £2,000. After this we got a few messages from people saying they would help us with the show for free. So then we deiced that we would create season 2 fully volentuerlly and that we would make a new kick-starter and the money would go to transport.

campaign.story:
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/Sally_TheSeries 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SallyTheSeries/?modal=admin_todo_tour 
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMNq-vntBX-dOg1cgErrWmQ 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/sally.theseries/ 
#SallyTheSeries 

Sally is Psychological, Satire, thriller drama based in a world populated by anthropomorphic characters, more commonly known as “Furries”. The first series takes place in London where a young teenage wolf named CODY gets swept up in trouble for a crime he didn't do. The first season is only 3 episodes long and revealed the seasons main world idea.
 No one is real.
Sally is a 6 year old little girl, with a twisted mind, making up all the story's. But why? In season 2 we will get a bit more of a look into Sally and why she is telling the story's that we are watching. As well as a new cast of lovable character. 
Watch Season 1 HERE:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sWtkjGp-DSc&t=291s 
SALLY started as part of our student university project. The original brief was to create only a three part web drama and run this across other social media platforms. 
However, the Sally series garnered an overwhelming amount of love and support. The production team had little idea how the pilot would be received, but in the six weeks after its premier on Youtube, the show has gathered an encouraging amount of attention; receiving numerous comments, fan-art, and support for the show as well as inquiries over more episodes. 
We're raising money to continue this beloved show. 
We care about this show so much because it is something we have always wanted pursue, being able to create fun content online for an audience.  We had no idea what would come of it but over the past 6 weeks have watched the show blossom. Receiving many comments, fan-art and support for the show, with people asking if there will be more episodes. 
As this was a university project it was scheduled to be completed at the end of march and for us to completely move on to a new project in April.  We don't want to end this series as we have many ideas and want to continue making episodes. However, the show costs a lot to produce so we need your help so we can continue it and to evolve the show into something greater! 

WHO WE ARE
The team started with 6 people. From the student project 3 of us have stayed on to continue the show. However we are receive help from you guys and people we know in the film world. 
Chantelle/Yoka - A Fursuit Maker who has been on YouTube for many years and has always wanted to create a successful show starring a diverse range of characters. One of her favourite shows is Bojack horseman and her favorite company is Pixar.
Em - As an aspiring producer and writer, it has always been a passion of hers to write and create shows that are unique and quirky within the horror/thriller genre.
Carlos - A photographer and content creator aspiring to one day become a film director. He sees this series as a chance to make his mark in the industry, assisting in his pursuit of a prosperous career in film making. With a tonne of ideas for sub-arcs and stories for the series, the future for the show looks exciting!

WHAT IS OUR PLAN?
Our plan is to raise enough funds for Season 2 by the end of May, so that production can begin in August/September, outputting 10, 10 minute long Episodes. The funds will go towards enlisting skilled professionals to work closely with us to produce and edit high quality episodes.
The reason for this is we brake up around this time ( finish the school year) so have a few months where we can go deep into production).
Whilst this fund raiser is live, work will be undertaken to script the episodes ready for production. Meanwhile working on merchandise and other content development until we have made the funds to go into production. 

So while our goal of £12,000 may seem like a LOT, we have provided you with a brake down so you can see where the funds are going!

Camera Operator: £2,200 is the cost to hire someone in London to come on set with us for 2 weeks to make sure all the visuals are as good as they can be! These funds are also including camera kit! 
[photo]
NOTE: If you would like to fund for this item/job role you will receive an Executive Producer Credit in the show. And receive an executive producer's goody bag which will contain lots of shows merchandise and goodies + a special secrete rewards just for executive producers. 


SOUND: £1,200 is the cost to hire someone in London to come on set with us for 2 weeks to make sure all of the sound for the show is spot on! Including voice acting! 

NOTE: If you would like to fund for this item/job role you will receive an Executive Producer Credit in the show. And receive an executive producer's goody bag which will contain lots of shows merchandise and goodies + a special secrete rewards just for executive producers. 

LIGHTING: £1,500
Help us fund this goal and we can hire someone to make sure all the lighting is very “lit”.
[Photo] Goal £4,900
NOTE: If you would like to fund for this item/job role you will receive an Executive Producer Credit in the show. And receive an executive producer's goody bag which will contain lots of shows merchandise and goodies + a special secrete rewards just for executive producers. 


DIRECTOR: £1,200  
Yoka will direct people regardless if she is getting paid or not. But she doses like being able to afford food…. Help fund this goal and we can then pay her!
NOTE: If you would like to fund for this item/job role you will receive an Executive Producer Credit in the show. And receive an executive producer's goody bag which will contain lots of shows merchandise and goodies + a special secrete rewards just for executive producers. 
+This perk also includes a signed framed poster of Yoka signed by her, herself! 

Post Production: £4,000
Help fund this goal so we can hire a supper-dupper editor to cut all of the pieces together and make this EPIC! 
NOTE: If you would like to fund for this item/job role you will receive an Executive Producer Credit in the show. And receive an executive producer's goody bag which will contain lots of shows merchandise and goodies + a special secrete rewards just for executive producers. 

Kick starter fees, shipping costs and transaction fees & Merchandise:  £1,400 
By reaching this goal we will have enough to cover costs for all the rewards plus other non-reward merchandise!  As well as cover all costs needed to pay transation fees and shipping costs. 
[photo] Goal: £11,500
NOTE: If you would like to fund for this item/job role you will receive an Executive Producer Credit in the show. And receive an executive producer's goody bag which will contain lots of shows merchandise and goodies + a special secrete rewards just for executive producers. 

Travel, Props + Other expenses: £500 
Otherwise we will have to dip in to our pockets for these things. 

That's our £12,000 Goal!
If we raise more then our goal all the money will go in the pot for season 3! Or to help us attend conventions to meet all of you!

campaign.story:
TheFandom is a documentary feature film! It provides a real life look into the furry community as told by our own artists and creators. We completed part one, a YouTube mini-series prequel. This Kickstarter is to fund part two which will be released as a feature film!
 Check out the mini-series (part one) below!
The Feature Film
For the film, we want to take an in-depth look at the early history of the fandom and explore our origins as the first internet subculture. We will focus on the individuals who helped to start our first conventions, meetups and facilitate artistic expression. Then, we will examine where we are headed as a community today. As furries ourselves we would like to show the world what our community is really about!  
Subjects that we will address:
 The furry fandom is, perhaps, the first subculture to rise with the internet. With its origins in the late '70s, furry grew out of the science-fiction communities, debuting the first furry convention in 1989. But while the internet provided a means of uniting this budding community, it also became a breeding ground for misconceptions about furry identity. 
This film will give you a glimpse of what makes the furry fandom so special to those who call themselves "furry". By interviewing the individuals who pioneered the fandom, we will explore this unusual community from the ground up, uncovering the passion, creativity, and the drive the inspires its members. We hope you join us on this journey! 
 The Cast (So Far)
These are just some amazing folks lined up to participate in the film, with more to be revealed shortly!
 Our cast is made up of some of the artists, creators and personalities that really drive our community forward.
FAQ
Dispatch date?
While the campaign proceeds and as we approach our target, we hope to start production in April after Kickstarter funding completes. We shouldn't have any delays because we'll be keeping an organized pipeline from past project experience. We'll also be keeping everyone fully up to date primarily on my Twitter (http://twitter.com/AshCoyote) and in journal posts via Kickstarter and our website http://thefandomfilm.com.
Payments? 
Payments are due at the end of the campaign, and will be charged immediately with a week to verify your payment. Payments that fail at the end of the Kickstarter will lose out on any stretch goal rewards. By backing you understand to budget yourself for the end of the campaign.
When can I send my address? 
If the Kickstarter is successfully funded, I'll be sending out a survey to all the backers to collect any information in regards to your shipping address. Please ensure you write it in the correct format and use your correct legal name.

campaign.story:
Throw Throw Burrito is what you get when you cross a card game with dodgeball. Try to collect matching sets of cards faster than your opponents while simultaneously ducking, dodging, and throwing squishy airborne burritos. The cards you collect earn points, but getting hit by flying burritos loses them. So clear some space and put away the antiques, because you’ve never played a card game quite like this before.
Since we created Exploding Kittens four years ago, we've been making games that bring friends and family together around a table, away from their screens. We brought this game to Kickstarter because we believe that adding a bit of physicality to game night is what comes next.
So, if you're into the idea of party games and weaponized Mexican food, please help us make this game a reality. We think you'll love it as much as we do.
Hugs and missiles,
-Elan, Matt, and the Exploding Kittens Team    
HOW DOES THIS WORK?
No Funding Goals, No Backer Goals, instead we want you to enter the Burrito Bowl! 
Compete in a series of incredible events to test your burrito themed prowess and we’ll upgrade your games for free!
Throw Throw Burrito started when our friend, Brian Spence, pitched a new game idea to us and we immediately fell in love. Over the next eight months, we worked closely with Brian to tune the game, design the cards, and destroy most of the fragile items in our homes.
The game went through many versions.
First, there was the "Mangoes with Animal Heads Phase":
Mango Pug
Then came the flying animal ideas: 
Then fruit: 
Then so many Mexican food ideas:
After finally choosing a name, Matt got to work on the cards: 
Character Exploration
Style Exploration
We wanted to put this project on Kickstarter because it's the fastest way for us to get the game into your hands and make improvements as a community. We think this game is great, but we need your help making it even better.
So if a world full of weaponized Mexican food is a world you want to live in, please back this project and help us build this game. 
With love and mad strafing skills,
- The Exploding Kittens Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge for our team is building the throwables. Since our Exploding Kittens campaign in 2015 (followed by Bears vs Babies, and You've Got Crabs), we've learned a lot about making cards and have shipped over 8 million decks of our games worldwide. But throwables are a new challenge. We're working with the finest toy manufacturers in the world to make sure that we deliver the best materials that are fun to throw (not too light) and don't hurt when they hit you (not too heavy).

It's also very important to us that everyone gets their game on time. We don't want this to be a campaign where you spend the next two years getting fifty emails about production updates and delays. If you back this project, we want you to start throwing burritos at your friends as soon as possible. This is why we're not offering t-shirts or other non-game related reward tiers that would make the distribution process take a lot longer. We're keeping it as simple as possible: support our project and in return we'll send you the game.

Hey Burrito Backers,
We are hosting a gaming convention called BURNING CAT!
Burning Cat is the tabletop conference we’ve always wanted to attend.
We rented out the Oregon Convention Center and plan to fill it with new games, new game designers, experimental prototypes, the infamous Exploding Kittens Vending Machine, vendors showing off the newest and greatest games and accessories, and a massive arena in the center to exhibit ludicrous stunts and insane spectacles every hour on the hour.

updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
We have so many things to say!

Playtesting
Now that most of the prototypes are in your hands, we've started receiving the first round of playtest feedback!

Hello, backers! 
Please don't forget that if your pledge included a prototype deck of Throw Throw Burrito, you MUST complete your BackerKit survey/form by 11:59 PM PST on Wednesday MAY 1, 2019 for your feedback to be considered in the final version of the game.
To quickly find the form, search your email inbox for “Response Needed -- Get your reward for Throw Throw Burrito.” If you still can’t find it, feel free to email support@explodingkittens.com and we’ll take care of you!

**********************************************
Electric Six and Kickstarter - The Final Chapter
Electric Six unveiled its first Kickstarter project almost 6 years ago, in 2013. It was a live concert film of a show at St. Andrew's Hall in Detroit, but the idea emerged out of  a planned film of a concert in London, England which was derailed when the company engaged to film it ended up pulling out of the project.  So we thought it was time to bring it all full circle. Electric Six has engaged in five previous Kickstarter campaigns and the sixth one will be the last one. Six bodies on stage in Electric Six.  Six senses. Six Kickstarter campaigns.  No better way to celebrate all that we, Electric Six and YOU, its fans, have accomplished together than by bringing it all back home in a sense and filming a live show in England, a place which has given so much to us over the years and which in a relatively direct way sparked the very idea of these projects.  
"Live In Liverpool" is exactly that, a film of a concert to take place on May 18 at Arts Club Liverpool. Much like "Absolute Treasure," the band's previous live concert film, "Live In Liverpool" will be a multi-camera shoot with some behind the scenes material included alongside the concert itself.  We'll be producing DVDs and Blu Ray versions, as well as digital only formats of the film (those who pledge for physical formats will also receive a digital copy). Additionally, we're going to provide every pledger with a CD and digital download version of the concert, for those moments when you just want to listen to the music undistracted by the overpowering beauty of Electric Six's collective visage.  The set will once again be a unique one, as we've done with all of our live projects over the years. You will get some of the classics you've all come to expect, but we'll bust out some newer material and some deep cutz as well...and there's always the wildcard of the pledger selected material to account for as well.  It's guaranteed to be a unique set the likes of which you haven't experienced before in its totality. We first played this venue in 2003, so we're bringing it all back home in that way as well. After careful consideration, we felt an intimate setting such as the one the Arts Club will offer should lend itself to a fantastic night and a great concert recording. We also remember how our UK and European fans felt they missed out years ago on the opportunity to be at a gig which would be filmed for release, to perhaps see their own faces on a screen, in ecstasy as they witness Electric Six...the circle will now be complete. To give you a partial preview of the songs we'll play, here are 8 which will definitely make it into the set, a mix of old favorites and new material, none of which have been on any of our live recordings previously:
Bride Of The Devil
         Daddy’s Boy
         How Dare You
         She’s Guatemalan
         Bite Me
         Mr. Woman
         Dance Pattern
         Lenny Kravitz
As usual, we expect to add lots of others via this campaign, between pledgers and pledger voting.
As this is the last Kickstarter project we'll do, we're including many of the old favorite packages to make sure those interested fans get one more opportunity to get items or experiences they've wanted, but we're also rotating some stuff out and  including some new ideas, given that it's the final campaign.
The biggest news is an item we've never offered before as a part of a Kickstarter campaign...Electric Six LIVE in the location of your choice.  See the reward section for details on this, as there are some conditions we unfortunately have to apply, most importantly that we have to limit it to the continental United States (it gets too complicated overseas, sadly). This will be the full band playing a "real" show...nothing stripped down, nothing acoustic...provided you've got the space and the gear to make it happen.
We're offering another Dick Valentine original, this time he'll create a suitable-for-framing larger size lyric sheet of the E6 song of your choice, complete with symbols and renderings in the margins which will make the words come even further alive.
A new item this time around is a special four poster package.  These posters will be conventional glossy "poster" style (not screenprints) and will include two  gig posters done by Tom Deja, who's done much of our artwork over the years (one of which will be for the Liverpool show), as well as "Bride Of The Devil" and "Daddy's Boy" posters by Nick Bataran. Get a slice of E6 past and present in poster form.
One of the images you'll receive as part of the 4 poster set package
Another poster to be included in the 4 poster set package, this one by Tom Deja
We're going to produce a photobook of the the Live In Liverpool show, which will also include some historical shots mixed in for good measure. It'll be  a mix of behind-the-scenes shots, photos of live performance and text, with most of the photos never before seen.
We're also offering some more conventional "merch" items, things we haven't done in the past (at least not everywhere), such as tote bags, pin sets, etc.
Old favorites include the opportunity to select a song for the show in Liverpool, or to perform with us at that show. If you don't play an instrument, don't worry, we'll get you on that stage with a mic in your grill one way or the other.  You can also select a song to be played as part of the Liverpool show, provided its an Electric Six song from one of the studio (i.e. non-Kickstarter and non-"Sexy Trash") records. We're also once again including a package where you can select a song for the band to cover and we'll make the results part of the subscription club package which any pledger can add to their rewards for $20 (those making pledges for packages of $500 or more once again will automatically be enrolled in the subscription club). You can also pledge to perform along with us on one of these recordings (either pledger or band selected, as we'll be doing some covers for the subscription club regardless)...we've had a ton of fun with these in the past. 
These people all performed on Electric Six studio recordings. You could be next!
We're also doing a third volume of the popular E6 Karaoke series. This disc is anticipated to include the following songs (as always, subject to change but this is what we think it'll look like):
 Infected Girls
            Slices Of You
            I Buy The Drugs
            Dirty Ball
            Escape From Ohio
            Clusterfuck
            Free Samples
            Kids Are Evil
            Arrive Alive
            How Dare You
            Bride Of The Devil
            Daddy’s Boy
There are lots of Dick Valentine-specific packages once again on offer. You haven't truly seen yourself until you've done so through the prism of a DV portrait of YOU. Want to learn how to write songs the Valentine way? There's a package for that. Name a character in his latest psycho-pornographic-noir-thriller, or take him on in a round of golf...it's all there one more time. 
Someone became a character in DV's last Bart Ducane book. Will the next one feature YOU?
The Subscription Club is once again an add on option for $20 (or free if you're pledging for a package of $500 or more). It'll feature outtakes, different mixes, photos and any of the covers we end up recording. For clarification purposes, the Subscription Club is a one year deal, so if you pledged for it last time, that one will end with December 2018's material, so doing so again in this campaign will get you access to the Club material for 2019 (4 times during the course of the year).
Be part of the magic, one more time, with Electric Six and Kickstarter. Join us as we document "Live In Liverpool" along with the most important people in the equation, you, the fans of Electric Six. As with so many other great things...the television series "M*A*S*H," the rotary phone and  civility being but three examples...Electric Six and Kickstarter has reached the Final Chapter. Write it along with us!
A couple of important things to note.  First, for any of the "experiential" packages, such as encores, dinner and a producer, etc...these must be cashed in during calendar 2019. We've been relaxed about that in previous campaigns but this time must insist that they be used within the 2019 touring schedule...this helps us keep track of outstanding obligations and allows us to plan in a more productive fashion.  For US and Canadian fans, figure that we'll be in all the usual places (and if you have a question about a particular city, send us a message). For the UK, Ireland and Europe, we've announced our UK/Ireland shows for November 2019 and some of the European shows.  German dates (several of them) will be going up soon and we will once again be in Paris, St. Petersburg and Moscow. There will likely be a few additional shows in May in the UK and Ireland...again, if you have questions about this relating to one of the packages, send us a message and we can work with you to confirm that we'll be in your area. Unfortunately, we do not have any other areas of the world (Australia most notably) on the schedule as of now and don't anticipate that changing as of this writing, though we certainly wish it would.
Second, every year we have some non US pledgers distressed to discover when their packages arrive that they've been assessed customs charges by their local governmental authority.  Please note there is NOTHING we can do about this. We are required by US law to mark packages accurately for customs purposes and we do so. See the project FAQ for more on this.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The "challenges" we face mostly surround fulfillment. Having mounted previous successful campaigns, we are confident that this project will be similarly successful. A certain percentage of pledgers from outside the US face issues with customs charges attaching to their rewards and that may occur again in this campaign. Again, there is NOTHING we can do about these charges, as we are required by US law to mark them accurately for customs purposes. If customs charges are objectionable to you, you owe it to yourself to investigate what they may be in your country and make pledging decisions accordingly. See the project FAQs for further discussion of this issue for non-US pledgers. We generally have outstanding success with packages arriving on the first go-around. Those that don't arrive receive a second attempt. The number of packages which truly have been "lost" over the previous five campaigns combined can be counted on one hand.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
For more information about this creator go to whenitsready.com 
For more information about this project go to thewowdiary.com
My name is John Staats, and I began writing The WoW Diary on March 17, 2001. I remember it was near midnight on a Saturday, during Blizzard’s 10th Anniversary Party. Instead of attending the company festivities, I was in my office, pensively thinking about dungeons because that's what the company's first 3D level designer does when dungeons aren't working. After six months, there was scant evidence that the game was going to work, certainly not under the budget or schedule we'd been given. WoW was my first experience with an unfinished game...and I couldn't believe that making one from scratch was this hard. I'd spent my first 6 months working over 90-hour weeks using the Quake 3 editor to build levels. I enjoyed the work, but the absence of progress was disturbing. There were many show-stopping issues with dungeons, and my only contribution to the project was to show that FPS technology, processes, and tools were incompatible with MMOs. After six long months, no one else on the team knew what to do either.
We couldn’t find experienced 3D level designers (willing to work for what the project could afford). Every week I send the company recruiter half a dozen "candidates" whose work I found on the internet--though none were interested. Nor had any suitable environmental texture artists applied for positions on our jobs page (and none of the staff artists wanted to work on dungeons). I wasn't even satisfied with what I was designing. I had to launch Quake 3 just to walk through my structures--and everything looked dark and edgy, just wrong for Warcraft. I began to worry, “Would we have to make our MMO without dungeons?"
That Saturday night, I put fingertips to keyboard and began my four-year chronicle about the games industry, Blizzard, Team 2, and WoW. Whether the project was a failure, or by some miracle, a success, I was convinced it was going to be a good story.
Computer game development is not pretty.
My book, The World of Warcraft Diary, offers a rare, unfiltered, comprehensive look at game development. I start at WoW’s humble beginnings, and give a fly-on-the-wall access to the dev team’s conversations, debates, failed experiments, and internal pressures. Licensed by Blizzard Entertainment, it contains over 130 behind-the-scenes images (many of which have never been seen before). Every image is captioned and dated within the project's timeline. 
Although the book has been licensed by Blizzard, I didn’t write it like the average promotional merchandise, or the typical art folio brimming with gorgeous concept sketches. In fact, I kept the pretty pictures out of the book. I am celebrating the chaotic, humorous, and ugly side of computer game development. I covered the people and philosophies behind the curtain. If you’ve ever wanted to know the ingredients inside Blizzard’s secret sauce, this book is for you.
Who is the author (John Staats)?  
I served on World of Warcraft for over 10 years. On the original product, I worked longer hours than anyone on the team. My ears were so low to the ground, my officemates and I played a game where they'd try to surprise me with recently heard gossip—and I took great delight informing them that I’d heard it weeks before. When I left the WoW team, I had logged more bug-fixes than anyone else in the company (Mike Morhaime joked that I’d probably caused more bugs).
After I joined Blizzard, so many of my misconceptions about the games industry were dispelled that I thought a development diary would be a compelling subject to cover. Most companies give only a short, vague idea how games are made. I wanted to give an on-the-ground report about the devs. I wrote about our teams’ complaints, moods, arguments, and inside jokes.  
My Vanilla WoW portfolio includes designing and building 90 percent of the game's non-instanced caves, crypts, dens, mines, and hive tunnels. My Vanilla WoW dungeons include:
Ahn’Qiraj Temple
Blackfathom Deeps
Blackwing Lair
Blackrock Mountain
Blackrock Depths
Booty Bay
Karazhan (w/Aaron Keller)
Loch Modan Dam
Lower Blackrock Spire
Molten Core
Razorfen Downs
Razorfen Kraul
Scholomance
The Slag Pit
Upper Blackrock Spire
The Wailing Caverns
Warsong Gulch (w/Matt Milizia)   
A few years ago, I developed a medical condition with my hands that prevents me from sustained computer use—including both making and playing computer games. With computer game development in my rear-view mirror, I am passing on what I learned about the industry.
Table of Contents (click for a readable image)
What production values can be expected?
As far as content goes, I am a polish-freak. I have rewritten, iterated, and edited the text eighteen times over, cramming in every detail I could muster from memory and notes. This narrative has also been subjected to four passes by professional editors; one for content, one for copy edits, and two separate proofreads. I don’t believe it is boastful to say the text embraces the principle of “concentrated coolness.”   
Before joining Blizzard, I had been in advertising for ten years, so I’ve lots of experience with printing. I’ve weathered angry glares from pressmen twice my age for holding back print runs for minor color corrections and errors. I will be on-press for this book to personally sign-off on every sheet and can guarantee that this will be a high-quality item.
The WoW Diary will be fancier than most books. For you printing nerds, it’ll be printed in the United States, on a brand-new press, a Heidelberg Speedmaster XL 106. This press uses a sheet-fed process which gives superior control over ink coverage—at double the cost of a web press (which is how most books are printed). It will be full-color, full-bleed (and varnished if necessary), and, of course, it made using a high-quality matt-coated paper stock. I will be on-press for weeks to sign off on every sheet. 
I expect The WoW Diary will become your go-to coffee table book.
Mock Up
What will backers receive?     
Electronic backers will receive a PDF and an eBook version of The WoW Diary after this campaign is funded (3-6 weeks after the Kickstarter closes). The PDF/eBook will have the same images and words, although The WoW Diary layouts/captions are best viewed through a full-spread format.
First Edition Backers will receive an Electronic Edition + a printed first edition of The WoW Diary, comparable to a 8” x 10” hardbound textbook with 336 full-color pages. It has over 95,000 words (the length of The Hobbit) and over 130 captioned images.  
Showcase Edition Backers get an Electronic Edition + a signed first edition of The WoW Diary encased in an sleeve (book case). Included inside the sleeve will also be a saddle stitch-bound booklet, containing four essays about the team after WoW shipped. I omitted them from the book because they fell outside the timeline (the book ends after I cover the game’s launch). While these essays will be available online, they make for worthy companion pieces.  
Press Sheet Edition - GONE! - backers will receive a Showcase Edition of The WoW Diary and one signed press sheet--used to approve the printing of the first edition of The WoW Diary. Each sheet will have my sign-off indicating the page is a "go" on the print run. There are 21 unique press sheets, roughly 22 x 36 inches in size, and there are 8 pages on each side of the sheet. I have no control over the imposition (arrangement of pages), but the odds are high (with over 130 images) that either side of the press sheet will have images. For a book that celebrates the production process, these complement the Kickstarter.
Press Sheet Mock-up (each are unique and limited to 20)
It looks like the book is already finished, what will the money be used for?
After ~8% goes to our good friends at Kickstarter, the money will support printing, binding, packaging, and shipping. It will also cover the operational costs and fees associated with selling extras on Amazon.com--extras that will be made available after the Kickstarter rewards have been fulfilled.  
Where I can get more information about The WoW Diary and John Staats?  
whenitsready.com has some juicy excerpts and covers my post-Kickstarter goings on. Updates on The WoW Diary will be made via Twitter @JohnStaats_WIR. If you don't want spam about my book’s progress, but you do want previews of my next project (a dungeon-based board game), sign-up to my email list.
This stretch goal will fund two versions of The WoW Diary. The first, will be the standard Amazon Edition that has all the high-end specs already listed. Then, I'll print a Golden Edition that will be for only and all of my Kickstarter First Edition backers. 
Upgrade 1: $300,000 - Funded! The end sheet (pictured below) will be gold that reads “Original Kickstarter Backer" followed the whenitsready logo. The mock-up (on the right) shows the subtle printing, and the magnification (on the left) is darkened and enlarged for readability. 
Upgrade 2: $350,000 - Funded! Gold foil title lettering on spine and front cover differentiates Kickstarter editions from non-KS prints. 
Upgrade 3: $400,000 - Funded! Spot varnishing makes all the pictures shiny and opens opportunity for shiny "ghost shapes" on an otherwise blank page. Very few books have this because it costs a lot, but if we hit this mark, I'll add it for free. 
This means all hardcover Kickstarter backers will have a rarer copy (only a few thousand worldwide) than later editions. The Gold Kickstarter Edition will never be reprinted. Owning one means you've helped found my new company, whenitsready and its flagship product, The WoW Diary.
Golden Edition End Sheet Mockup
By reaching the Golden Stretch Goal, The WoW Diary would have become, at least, the 3rd highest funded non-fiction book in Kickstarter's history. The only way to make this happen is to tell your friends. Tweet and Share this link to let everyone know you support The WoW Diary. Let your freak flag fly and distinguish your copy from future printings.
Read below for achievement details.
 The Golden Bookmark Achievement System
The reward for this achievement is a special bookmark, of which I am not showing. The bookmark design isn’t a “secret” because I’m not finished with it yet, it’s design has been done for over a year and I want it to be a surprise when you receive your hardback edition of The WoW Diary. It has two Easter eggs, one of which refers to something in the book, the other won’t be apparent until I release my next project, a dungeon-based board game. The Golden Kickstarter version of this bookmark will never be reprinted again (extras will be destroyed at the printer). 
By reaching 300 achievement points all Kickstarter backers will receive a golden (Kickstarter) bookmark with each hardcover.
Some quotes from the book:   
“Until YouTube began streaming videos a year later, WoW servers handled over 10 percent of global Internet bandwidth in downloads, and its players contributed to roughly half of active global Internet traffic at any given time. The sun never sets on the Warcraft empire.”  
“Since the point of a database was to always know where game’s data was located, it was no small irony when WoW’s entire database was lost. While the database system was working and on the network, somewhere in the building, the hardware itself had been forgotten and no one could locate the machine when an upgrade became necessary.”  
“During the tornado….A facility technician heroically shuts down a ‘450 volt power inverter’ (triple the voltage of a hair dryer) while standing in a room-wide, quarter-inch deep puddle. The Blizzard techs were in awe of his daring, as water dribbled, from a beam above, onto the very units he was powering down.”  
“Blizzard’s rarely used PA system sounded, ‘Attention: The WoW beta is live. I repeat: The WoW beta is live. The first transport is away!’ The dev team was unprepared for the announcement, since we’d been waiting days for AT&T to fix their stupid facility issues, so it was met with almost no reaction. We were more impressed that we had a PA system. A few people looked out of their office doors so see if any team gatherings were happening, but nothing ensued, so everyone went back to work. A few of us even laughed at how little enthusiasm the team showed.”

updates.update_content:
We are finally inside the Amazon machine. I've been busy with their customer service and parsing their Sellers Marketplace Interface. 
The short story: We are waiting for amazon to fully "receive" the inventory that arrived in May. When it becomes available, then I can upload the list of addresses for replacement Kickstarter rewards.

After another month of ups and downs I'm finally comfortable with my delivery dates. I'm fulfilling two shipments. 
Overseas Fulfillment
The first is replacing missing Kickstarter copies abroad and delivering presale orders (purchased between November through May). I could go into great detail about Amazon's crazy specificity, but I'm sick of thinking about all the hoops I've jumped through these past two months. My printer is currently putting my self-contained packages inside of larger cartons. In 10 business days everything will be packaged and labeled.

With about 100 people on my "missing packages list," I took a poll a few weeks ago. I emailed all 40 of my Polish backers to see what they thought about waiting longer or getting replacements. Surprisingly, the majority said to give their original packages a longer wait to reach their doorstep. So I waited. In the past month, I've had 3 Slovenian backers report of their deliveries (Poland and Slovenia had the most missing deliveries)...so there's a modicum of hope still for our friends in Western Europe. But still, it's been over three months and too many people haven't received their rewards.

You Guys Rock
When I'm juggling things (more on this below) it's easy to forget all the good vibes I'm getting from you guys. Yesterday it dawned on my that I never related in my updates how helpful, informative, and supporting my backers have been. You guys are truly terrific people and I'd like to thank you. Your emails are filled with encouragement and appreciation, and I've not yet reflected this in these updates. Even the presale customers (who are waiting for their books too) have been 100% understanding.

Hi Gang. If you're already enjoying The WoW Diary, you can ignore this message. 
This update is only about delivering the original Kickstarter rewards. PRESALE orders haven't shipped yet. If you ordered after the Kickstarter please sit tight. I'll ship your books after Kickstarter backers are taken care of.   ;)
Ah, yes, shipping!  While some overseas customers complained about shipping prices, some warned me I wasn't charging enough! I now know why.

Don't Panic! I've finally marked all orders as shipped. The Backerkit UI doesn't make the distinction between orders shipped and fulfilled (I consider this to be when backers have their rewards), but I as long as we know the difference then that's what counts. The status of "shipped" simply means your book has left the warehouse. I wouldn't even guess that half of them are in the hands of backers, but they are all en route. 
Today I sent to my printer's delivery department the second list of backers who needed replacement rewards. These were the late payers, anyone whose books were damaged, and for Americans who never received their copies. The first batch of replacements are shipping tomorrow (or so says my printer), so it's taking 2 weeks for them to prepare, label, and order a truck to pickup new deliveries.    :(
