There are lots of great iPhone stands that do perfectly well what they've been designed to do. But they're either too bulky to be always carried along; or have pre-set angles that don't adjust intuitively.
The Pocket Tripod has been designed to be the most practical iPhone stand ever, by making it so portable, that you'll always have it with you in your wallet; and by giving you complete tilt-adjustment freedom.
The Pocket Tripod is as thin as two credit cards stacked on top.

Portrait, Landscape, Upside-down, it all works. Since the iPhone has a uniform edge cross-section, it can fit inside the cut-outs of the Pocket Tripod with any of its four edges. This is what makes adjusting the iPhone to any angle possible with Pocket Tripod, both in landscape and portrait.
The Pocket Tripod can hold the iPhone both in landscape and in portrait.

Adjusting the angle of the iPhone with the Pocket Tripod is done the same way as on a full sized photography tripod. Unlike most portable stands that use tabs to lean the iPhone on, the Pocket Tripod actually gives you smooth, uninterrupted 90° sweeps of tilt adjustment. Its unique design let's you quickly and precisely aim your iPhone to any angle you like.
A combination of four 90° sweeps lets the Pocket Tripod hold the iPhone at any angle.
From concept to reality, making the Pocket Tripod a market-ready product has been an awesome ride. It's taken a year and a half of meticulous engineering and prototyping to end up with a design that can efficiently take advantage of every millimeter-cube of an extremely finite space; literally the size of a couple of credit cards.
The challenge was to divide this limited volume into just the right geometries, that would allow the pocket tripod to intuitively transition between forms, yet still be manufacturable. The result is a highly refined product, that matches the design and quality of the iPhone itself. 
The pocket tripod is the only portable stand of its size that can hold the iPhone at the most extreme angles, even in portrait.
Even though the idea of the Pocket Tripod is based on simple concepts, a lot of innovation has gone into making it a reliable and easy to use product.
Find out more about the design of the Pocket Tripod here.
Rewards for our Backers
Delivery Dates
The promised dates take into to account unexpected setbacks. We expect to deliver the rewards earlier than the promised dates.

Future iPhone Models 
We all know Apple releases a new iPhone model every year, and a lot of us can't help ourselves but to upgrade to the newest iPhone. Rest assured, we'll be developing a Pocket Tripod compatible with the upcoming model. If you upgrade your iPhone before we deliver your reward, we'll be happy to change your reward to one that is compatible with your iPhone at the time. We will also be happy to send you upgrade modules at no cost, if you upgrade your iPhone to the iPhone 6 within a year after we deliver your reward.

iPhone with a Case
We're working on compatibility modules that will allow the Pocket Tripod to work with some of the most popular slim iPhone cases. Below is a list of cases that are showing promising potential. Following a successful funding of the project, we will be able to test the Pocket Tripod's compatibility with these cases. If we are happy with the results, and you use one of the tested and approved cases, we'll be glad to swap your reward if we haven't shipped it already, or send you a compatibility module for that case at no charge, within a year after delivery of your Pocket Tripod.
Check the official Pocket Tripod website to find the latest compatibility modules.
The Pocket Tripod
At the most basic level, we want to thank you by sending you a Pocket Tripod, available in your choice of black or white, both with a high quality, glossy finish, similar to all of Apple's iPhone accessories. 
Limited Edition Pocket Tripod
This special model will be manufactured in limited quantities, only for our trendsetting KickStarter backers, and won't be available for retail afterwards. It proudly wears the official KickStarter colours to prove you supported this project when we needed you most!
Origami design T-Shirt 
The design of this T-shirt was the winner of a graphic-design contest set to create the best T-shirt design for our awesome KickStarter backers. We instantly fell in love with this design because the graphic designer - one of 9 contestants - really had a unique vision. The T-shirt's design resembles origami instructions that have been wrapped around the torso. The graphic designer was inspired by how after twisting and folding, the pocket tripod transforms from a flat card, into a beautiful three-dimensional object with a purpose.
We're having this T-shirt made just for you, our KickStarter backers, and we wanted to make sure that the design emphasizes the fact that you were directly responsible for the success of the Pocket Tripod.
We're planning to make these T-shirts in both men and women cuts. To find out exactly what size to order, click below for the:
Men's size chart.      or      Women's size chart.
Pocket Tripod App 
Since the Pocket Tripod is meant to be compatible with the iPhone, we thought it would be an awesome idea to let iPhone users have a first-hand test-drive of the Pocket Tripod. So we decided to put the iPhone's powerful graphics processor to good use by making a free app that has a 3D model of the Pocket Tripod in it, to give you the closest experience possible to actually holding a Pocket Tripod in your hands.
The Pocket Tripod app lets you virtually interact with the Pocket Tripod and really get a closer look of its form and function. The app lets you transform the virtual Pocket Tripod from one shape to another, and interact with a virtual iPhone; it even lets you experiment with different colours for the Pocket Tripod. We've been working with a fantastic app developer for the past 6 months to bring this wonderful app from just an idea, to reality; and we're really proud of the results. 

Credits
ThreeDeePixel, development of the Pocket Tripod App
Federico Lopez, 3D animation for KickStarter video
Marie-Christine Daudelin, 3D animation for KickStarter video
Bijan Thornycroft, origami design T-shirt Graphic Artist
Alexandros Batsoulis, original soundtracks for the KickStarter video
Bronze Radio Return, Special thanks for letting us to use their song, Shake!Shake!Shake! in our KickStarter video. 
Pocket Tripod's Design Innovations
Development of the Pocket Tripod 
Design Evolution: The design of the Pocket Tripod has gone through dozens of iterations and prototypes to arrive at a real-world product that embodies the original concept, and that can be manufactured. The original concept of the Pocket Tripod was to split a rectangle the size of a credit card in half from the diagonal-line, to create two right triangles, and use these two halves to hold an iPhone. From that point on, each iteration addressed solutions to enhance the product, as room for improvements were discovered. With a lot of hard work and innovative thinking, over the course of seventeen months, the Pocket Tripod evolved into a highly refined product that could be used reliably.
Design evolution of the Pocket Tripod shown through milestone rapid-prototypes.
Manufacturing Plan: Throughout the development of the Pocket Tripod, we’ve been working hand in hand with an experienced mold manufacturer to ensure the complex geometries of the product can in fact be manufactured. Their feedback has been invaluable in guiding the evolution of the Pocket Tripod’s design. To ensure that the final product works flawlessly, we’re planning to start production by manufacturing a prototype mold first. A prototype mold will give us the freedom to bug-out any unforeseeable production challenges. Unlike the full production mold, its moving components function manually, which will give us the freedom to fine-tune the mold until we get the dimension just right so that it produces the perfect parts that compensate for the plastic's shrinkage. We’ve arrived at a final design that works great, and can be manufactured. Our mold maker has designed the prototype mold, and is waiting for our green light to start cutting steel.
The prototype mold design is ready, and we're waiting on your support to start manufacturing.

Production: The development of the prototype mold is expected to take ten to twelve weeks, taking into account any unexpected hiccups. Once we’re sure how to manufacture the Pocket Tripod, we’ll proceed onto manufacturing the full production mold. This mold will manufacture the final product, and all it’s moving parts will be automated to ensure a seamless, and reliable production. This mold will be integrated into an automated injection molding system that injects molten plastic at high pressures into the cavities of the mold. The Pocket Tripods manufactured with the full-production mold will have a glossy surface finish, similar to all of Apple’s plastic iPhone accessories. Manufacturing this mold is expected to take an additional eight to ten weeks, after which we will start production of the Pocket Tripods. 
  Assembly, Packaging and Fulfillment: The Pocket Tripod is an assembly of six parts. Each part is made separately by the injection molding system, which then needs to be assembled by a worker piece by piece. Once all the pieces are put together and tested for functionality, the completed units are packaged and shipped to our warehouses. One of the best advantages of having a product that’s the size of a couple of credit cards is that it can ship at a very affordable cost. To this end, we’re planning to keep its packaging as minimalistic as possible. The Pocket Tripods will be tightly wrapped with a tape-like packaging that will have the product’s information and graphics printed on it. The packaging will be manufactured in parallel to the Pocket Tripod's production. Each Pocket Tripod is then sent to you, our backers, in the order we receive your pledges, using USPS first class mail and parcels.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One thing that really sets the Pocket Tripod apart, is its unconventional design. Needless to say, manufacturing it won't be the easiest of tasks. The Pocket Tripod has lots of undercuts and protrusions that are meant to guide and hold its pieces within set paths. Most of these features are almost microscopic, so that they can fit within the very thin volume of the Pocket Tripod. Because of that, the Pocket Tripod will require lots of attention during manufacturing. To manufacture the Pocket Tripod we will be using an automated injection molding system, that will comprise of many moving parts, and even robotic fingers to remove the parts from the mold without scratching them. Luckily the mold will be manufactured by a veteran mold maker and his team, who has had over 35 years of mold making experience here in the US. 
We'll be relying on their expertise to manufacture the Pocket Tripod. 

Due to the high manufacturing precision required for flawless functionality of the Pocket Tripod, we need to bug out any unexpected problems before investing in a fully automated mold. This is why we're planning to start manufacturing the Pocket Tripod, by first making a prototype mold. The prototype mold will give us the chance to fine tune the dimensions to get the exact performance that we need. Once we're sure about the manufacturing process, perfected through the development of this prototype mold, we'll start tooling the fully automated production mold; and as a special thank you, we're planning to send out a limited number of sample Pocket Tripods made using this prototype mold to our Backers.

One of the most challenging parts of producing the Pocket Tripod will be getting the friction of the swivel pieces just right. Too little and the iPhone will slip to the horizontal position, too much and it will be cumbersome to use. We need to hit the perfect balance, which we're planning to achieve by experimenting on the prototype mold. We'll be trying different surface finishes, tolerances and possibly coatings to make sure we know how to achieve the perfect "feel" before investing in the full production mold. This can only be achieved with the help of our backers. We've been able to develop this product to its current state on our own, but because of the high cost of tooling, we can't afford to go on to full production without your help. We're confident that with your help, and our hard work, we can make one of the best iPhone stands ever made.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Thanks for an amazing campaign!

http://www.doublefine.com/forums/
For Paypal, Bitcoin, and Slacker Backer options, head to: http://www.massivechalice.com/back/
If turn-based tactics and feudal fantasy had a lovechild, and that offspring founded a mighty century-spanning dynasty, it would be MASSIVE CHALICE.
With your help, MASSIVE CHALICE will become a reality—forged by Double Fine with our 3D in-house Buddha Engine and unleashed on Windows, Mac, and Linux.
Battling alongside ancestors (early concept)
We're inspired by classic tactical strategy games like X-COM, Final Fantasy Tactics, and Fire Emblem, as well as Game of Thrones’ array of noble families. With these influences in mind we’re creating an epic, replayable turn-based tactics game where you train generations of heroes to repel a demonic invasion.
And with Kickstarter, we can do it. We have a great concept and team ready to go, and we want to work closely with our community to control the future of MASSIVE CHALICE free from outside interference.
MASSIVE CHALICE is a single player turn-based tactics game within a multi-generational strategy campaign built for replayability.
As an immortal King or Queen, you must unite your kingdom under a powerful dynasty, eliminate the demonic threat, and reforge the MASSIVE CHALICE!
The game is structured into two main layers: strategy and tactics. In the strategy layer, you oversee your kingdom, arrange royal marriages, conduct research, and make the far-reaching decisions that will determine the fate of your legacy.
In the tactics layer, you fight brutal turn-based battles to defend your kingdom using small squads of customizable heroes.
Forest environment (early concept) - click for Hi-Res version
Permadeath is inevitable: your heroes will grow, age, and eventually die. You'll have to choose between keeping your favorite heroes on the battlefield or retiring them from combat to foster a new generation of warriors.
A Hero (early concept)
Drawing from roguelikes we love, content is modular and randomized. Each playthrough begins with a random assortment of male and female heroes from various bloodlines, guaranteeing that each game is unique. Your knowledge and skill will increase over multiple playthroughs, but the details of every game will change based on your decisions and the whims of fate.
Strategic map (early concept)
Core Game Features
Your story emerges as you defend against attacks, complete quests, and respond to randomized events in your attempt to preserve the kingdom.
Line of sight and fog of war mechanics come into play as your squad explores beautiful dynamic 3D battlefields where danger may lurk behind any corner.
Distinct, customizable heroes learn new melee, ranged, and arcane abilities as they age and gain combat experience.
Arrange marriage alliances to ensure your heroic bloodlines can handle any future combat situation.
Battle alongside your ancestors by equipping your heroes with uniquely powerful Bloodline Relics.
Invest your resources in forging new weapons and armor—and gamble on polluting a bloodline by researching dangerous demonic artifacts.

Another Double Fine Kickstarter?
Last year, you Kickstarted Double Fine Adventure, shattering records and bringing video games to the Kickstarter spotlight! Now known as Broken Age, that game is in full production and is already a beautiful and unique experience—but the Broken Age team only represents a third of our multi-game studio.
Double Fine’s goal is for all our teams to remain independent and responsible directly to their players. Kickstarting MASSIVE CHALICE allows us to maintain a pure creative vision, put out updates on our own schedule, respond to feedback without roadblocks, and release it all DRM-free.
Where are your stretch goals?
This Kickstarter is clean and simple. We’re asking for the minimum amount to make an awesome game, and the game’s scope will grow based on the amount of total backing we receive. There will be ongoing conversations with the community as new features are considered, so stay tuned and let us know what you'd like to see in the game!
For MASSIVE CHALICE we’re getting back to basics and focusing on the project itself. We’re a team passionate about turn-based strategy, and we want to craft a new Double Fine world by partnering with you!
Limited edition poster designed by Cory Schmitz
Limited edition t-shirt designed by Cory Schmitz
2 Player Productions is well known to Double Fine fans as the awesome team of filmmakers behind the Double Fine Adventure and Amnesia Fortnight documentary series.
It turns out they aren't sick of us yet! If the project is funded, 2 Player will be able to create a series of development diaries chronicling the creation of MASSIVE CHALICE. These will be released to the general public, but backers will also get exclusive access to high-quality HD downloadable versions ($50 tier and above).
Project Lead: Brad Muir
MASSIVE CHALICE is helmed by Brad Muir, creator of Iron Brigade, the fan-favorite tower defense mech shooter. A longtime Double Fine veteran, Brad served as a programmer on Psychonauts and a designer on Brütal Legend. Brad is a turn-based strategy and roguelike fanatic, and is the friendliest guy you'll ever meet! :D!
Double Fine Productions is an award-winning, independent game development studio founded in 2000 by games industry veteran Tim Schafer. Located in San Francisco’s South of Market district, Double Fine is committed to making high-quality games with an emphasis on originality, story, characters, and fun.
The MASSIVE CHALICE team comprises artists, designers, and engineers who recently worked on Double Fine projects like The Cave, Brütal Legend PC, Dropchord, Middle Manager of Justice, and various prototypes. The crew is ready to work on something big. Something MASSIVE.
The Buddha Engine
MASSIVE CHALICE is being developed with Buddha, our versatile in-house 3D engine first created for Brütal Legend. We know Buddha like the back of our hand—because our hand is coded in C++, scripted in Lua, and rigged with Maya.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
MASSIVE CHALICE is a new kind of game from Double Fine, but that’s what makes it perfect for Kickstarter, a place where new ideas can be given a chance by passionate fans. We believe we can find a substantial audience for this unique combination of strategy, squad tactics, and multi-generational gameplay.

MASSIVE CHALICE is still in its earliest stages, so its backers will join us for every phase of development. We're tackling a new genre for Double Fine, but building on our years of experience making games of all types with our own technology.

Games are complicated and expensive projects, but MASSIVE CHALICE has been scoped appropriately for our fundraising goal. By targeting open PC platforms and relying on a modular game design, we can create a core experience and build on it over time. The more backing we receive, the more systems and content we can create, and the better the game will be!

Most importantly, we're passionate about what Double Fine can bring to fantasy tactics games, and we're dedicated to rewarding our community with the best game possible.

So please support MASSIVE CHALICE, spread the news, and join us on our journey!

campaign.story:
It's Dangerous to Go Alone...The Movie is a documentary about the ubiquity and cultural influence of the Legend of Zelda franchise.  We have begun production on this film, and after putting much of our own time and money into it, realize we can not do it proper justice without help from the Zelda community!  Based on what we've already invested into this project, we've estimated travel, legal, and production costs for the experience we'd like to create for you.  Filming this project will take us on travels all around the country as we sit down for intimate interviews with current creatives of all types who were first inspired by the Zelda series.  
Please help us make this project a reality.
Here is an early 90 second teaser trailer of the film.
TEASER TRAILER:
As a thank you to those who have donated, and a call for help to those who have not donated yet, here is an exclusive look at a two minute segment from the film of the Symphony of the Goddesses, its performing musicians, and its creators, examining the ascension of Zelda's music from nostalgic, 8bit chiptunes to this 4 movement, symphonic experience.
EXCLUSIVE LOOK:
WHAT IS THIS PROJECT?
From the time most of us first touched the 8 bit cartridge, our lives were changed.  As children, the fantasy game contained in that golden plastic NES cartridge was our initiation into our own imaginations.  
Many of us have gone on to become creatives...writers, filmmakers, game designers, painters, sculptors, illustrators, animators...and we owe our first creative compulsions to our adventure contained in that golden cartridge.
The game franchise continues this day to inspire and compel new generations.  With a huge library of licensed games and an unending well of quality, unlicensed media, our film will be its own narrative adventure story through which it will explore the games' far reaching influence.  It will examine the pervasive fascination for 8-bit gaming beyond nostalgia, and how it has evolved from its tiny blocks of color to a form of fine art. It will explore the roots of the innate, international appeal of this game series that bridges across cultural divides.  And for those of you who have invested thousands of hours in the world of Hyrule, it will validate your passion.
Not only that, but it will be a playable documentary.  For those that are interested in a non-traditional way to watch a documentary, an interactive version of the documentary will be available.  It will be its own adventure game that will serve as a metaphor for the film, and through the unique virtual adventure, you will be able to find pieces of the film, bonus material, and behind the scenes footage.
Here is a proof of concept image of the documentary/game being played on an iPad (also represented in the video for this project).  While the art style is still being discussed and assets still being created, this offers a general idea of tone and concept.
PROOF OF CONCEPT for interactive version of film.
We feel that this idea will make for a unique, interactive, experience with much replay value that will be appropriate for a documentary about the influence of the Legend of Zelda.
Thank you so much for your interest and your support.
WHAT ARE OTHERS SAYING?
The film has gotten some great press and support from the Zelda community.  Check out these links for awesome support from around the web!
Zelda Universe Interview
Zelda Informer Collaboration
Zelda Dungeon Article
Nintendo Enthusiast
FilmPulse.com Feature and Podcast
Early Production Stills
Here are a few images from early production.  We hope you enjoy them!  We have a lot more cool stories to tell...this barely scratches the surface.  Some of these may end up on the cutting room floor, but there's plenty of room for bonus material!   This gives you a very small taste of what we've done so far, and a very general gauge of where we may be going.  We want to leave some surprises for you!
Symphony of the Goddesses
Having an in depth look at, and a one on one talk with the creators of, the Symphony of the Goddesses.
Legend of Zelda Cosplay
Looking at fandom in general, featuring some great Zelda-inspired cosplay.
Games inspiring art...
Artist Chris Veal, creating his nostalgic art.
The Hero of Time
Joel, creator of the feature length Hero of Time film and starring actress Hannah, who portrayed Zelda in it, discuss the project's creation, its unexpected attention, its criticism, and their opinions on the prospects of a Hollywood feature length Zelda film.
Zelda Outlands
Rom hacks don't even scratch the surface.  We sit down with Zack, creator of Zelda Outlands; is a compelling new chapter of the 8 bit original that plays on a NES playable cartridge.
Gamer's Edge - a great Retro Gaming store
Retro gaming is alive and well at independent game stories across the country.  In fact, according to employees (and huge Zelda fans) at places like Gamer's Edge, NES era games sell almost as well as current gen games.
Adventure
In case it is not obvious by this point...this documentary will not be a string of youtube videos with voice over.  It will follow its own adventure (as a true film about zelda should!), through which it will weave together several personal accounts of established creatives and artists inspired by the series.  
The Website...game...thing...
The website for this project is its own 8-bit adventure in a parodic style of those games we all loved.  The navigation for the website IS the game itself.  Many people have played and enjoyed the project, however in order to update and improve, we have taken it down for the duration of the Kickstarter Campaign.  It should be live again the first week of June.
The Teaser Trailer Music
The teaser trailer music was composed specifically for this trailer.  Its outline is based on the common chord progression that opens the original game's main theme, and its melodies and musical motifs are playfully derivative or reminiscent of those found in the rest of the game, reworked into a nostalgic musical homage.  Here it is without the voice over or interview clips from the trailer.  Enjoy!

Hello, friends.  You guys likely know that this project has been frozen in carbonite for the last few years, and unfortunately will likely not ever be created in the way that was originally intended.  However, many of you might remember that I'd already filmed some footage in my travels.  What ever happened to that footage?
We've decided to use some of it, in its most basic, raw, unpolished, zero budget form as bonus material for The New 8-bit Heroes documentary, as it truly was a sort of prequel venture for what ultimately became a very successful documentary!
If you'd like to find out more about that, make sure to find that project on social media, subscribe to our youtube channel, etc, as that's how you can find out when it will be released.

updates.update_userinfo: Zelda doc supporters, you have been summoned!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone - for those that have missed the memo, there is a cousin-project to the Zelda doc that I am working on in the interim.  It is doing incredibly well and might be just the kick that I'll need to relaunch the Zelda doc in the not-so-distant future. 
You were all so generous with your support on Kickstarter for the Zelda doc, please take a moment to check out this other awesome retro-gaming inspired project I'm involved with, and if you dig it, please show it the same love!

Unfortunately, the Kickstarter did not kick, however we are moving forward with the project, and have a few private investors interested in supporting it.  While we have not found the exact scenario we're looking for quite yet, the project marches on!
I sent you guys a link to sign up for the newsletter a few days ago.  Here's a non-Facebook link for those of you who are not on FB!
http://dm-mailinglist.com/subscribe?f=463d5903

27 hours and counting.  A long way to go.  Though the Kickstarter may not happen, we have private investors currently interested in helping see the project come to life.  Please follow the link below and sign up so that we can keep you up to date via email about the project's progress.  It may take a little longer, but this documentary will get done, for I hath decreed it so!
Head to this site and sign up so we can keep in touch!  And if you haven't liked the page yet on FB, do that while you're there too.  Thanks for all the support, everyone.  You guys are awesome!

The future looks grim, but I am unshaken in my determination to bring you this project.  It is the time to pull out all the stops in telling everyone you know to head here and pledge (we've redirected www.TheZeldaMovie.com to the kickstarter, which should make it easier).  
Please help by tweeting, sharing info on facebook walls, however else you can get the word out.  If you know someone at an online publication, see if they'll post a story.  If you know someone who has an awesome nerdy facebook group, have that person put it out to their peeps and give their endorsement.  Let's go out fighting!

Finally, we are able to demonstrate some proof of concept images and a little video of our INTENDED form of digital distribution.  It's very rough and very early, but you get the idea.  This will be a documentary that is also a playable adventure game in the spirit of the game series which it examines.  Check out the new project video for an early draft of a screen capture!

Yes...we heard loud and clear...you, the fans, want a digital distribution option!
You have all tenaciously expressed your interest in the film, and many of you who are international have very fairly expressed disappointment in not having this option.  It was always a plan, it just is coming together much more slowly than we anticipated.
For that reason, we offer the BOOMERANG PACKAGE at $15.  This is for a digital only copy of the film.  What form this will take is still a question (all else fails, a direct download link for you...but we're hoping for something much more interesting - and working very hard on it!)

I just wanted to say how much I appreciate your support of this project, whether it be $1 or $1000.  You guys make this project worth doing.
We have slowed considerably, and the problem is not of interest, it's simply a matter of visibility.  So please help push info about this Kickstarter out into the world!  Share on facebook, share on twitter, etc.  Tell the world!  Make sure all your retro gaming freaks and zelda fans know about it!

We came out swinging - over 5k in 24 hours.  Then, things began to slow.  We're sitting at 8k after a week...which is commendable!  But it's obvious as to why things are slowing down...that first day, the announcement hit the web hard!  When it was visible, people responded.  Now that it's tucked back into blogs' history, it's out of sight and out of mind.  I'm not concerned.  We have a long way to go, but also a lot of time.  However, I'd like to try and stay as visible as possible.  This project may not get funded, but I hate for the reason why to be that people just didn't know about it.

NEW UPDATE! - April 29th
Congrats everyone we are 10% funded!!!  We still have a ways to go so don't stop sharing this!  Help spread it to the masses and let your friends and family know how bad you want to see a Portal movie!  We are currently working on a short concept film for the movie that will really get people excited so keep sharing and pledging!  Thanks you guys :)
NEW REWARDS!!!
We have added new rewards to benefit lower-level pledges!  Now every pledge of $10 or more includes a high-quality download of the original soundtrack AND an SD (standard definition) digital download of Portal: Lab Rat when its finished!  The HD digital download is saved for pledges of $30 or more.
All rewards ONLY available through this Kickstarter!!!
That's right.  All the rewards are totally exclusive to this Kickstarter campaign!  You will not be able to get the Portal: Lab Rat DVD/Blu-Ray, t-shirt, signed poster, Collector's Package, signed props, wallpaper, HD download or anything else once this Kickstarter campaign ends!
Stretch Goals!
Portal: Lab Rat will start out as a 30-minute film for $60,000.  The more we raise through this kickstarter, the longer the movie will be!  If you want a full-length 80-minute Portal movie then we will do it!  But we have to raise enough to make it happen.  Here are a few stretch goals!
$90,000 - Movie length increased to 45-minutes!
$115,000 - ATLAS and P-body will become characters in the film!
$175,000 - Movie length increased to 1 hour!
$250,000 - Movie will be a full-length 80-minute feature film!

We know that this looks like a lot of money, but the truth is, for what we are making, it isn't!  Movies are very expensive, especially if its a sci-fi movie with a bunch of talking robots in it!
What is Portal: Lab Rat?
From the guys who brought you Left 4 Dead - The Movie, Portal: Lab Rat is a live-action movie written, directed and produced by Colin and Connor McGuire and based on the popular game Portal.  Portal: Lab Rat will run approximately 30-minutes or more and will feature suspense, mystery, action and a bit of humor, all in an enticing and believable Portal universe.  Much of the shoot will take place at The YouTube Space LA, on one of the massive sound stages they have generously donated. When finished, Portal: Lab Rat will be uploaded to youtube for the whole world to enjoy!
VGHS season 2, one of the most successful kickstarter film/video projects of all time was also filmed here at the YouTube Space LA.
The Story
For Those Familiar with the Video Game Portal
This movie explores the story of Chell and her adventures in solving the puzzling test chambers of Aperture Science, in order to satisfy the test-happy, maniacal A.I. GLaDOS, who's running them.  This movie also explores the story of the official Portal 2: Lab Rat comic released by Valve which serves as a tie-in comic for the events between Portal and Portal 2. Essentially, the storyline of the movie is split between two characters, Chell and Doug Rattmann from the Lab Rat comic, (the man behind the mysterious writings on the walls in Portal, most notably "the cake is a lie") and follows them as they both discover the hidden intentions of the dangerous A.I., GLaDOS. Through a series of events, their fates become intertwined and Doug Rattmann finds that he must do all in his power to ensure that Chell defeats GLaDOS. This is the untold story of Chell's mysterious beginnings, as well as the infamous scientists of Aperture Science.  This movie will explore the world of Portal in a way that no one ever has before.  The majority of fan films out there are humor based, or just too light in their story.  We are really striving to make a film that can be watched and enjoyed by all audiences of every age; a film with heart, soul, and mystery.
"The Discovery" Original Concept Art by Florian Moncomble
This concept piece shows Chell during her initial testing phase. She is not really outside, but rather in a simulated environment, deep in the underground chasms of Aperture Science. Chell must use her wit and tenacity to solve this puzzle, constructed for her by GLaDOS.
For Those NOT Familiar with the Video Game Portal
Based on the widely-celebrated video game Portal, this movie tells the story of a young girl named Chell (the main protagonist from the game) who is woken up from a sleep-like stasis deep inside a mysterious underground facility in order to undergo a phase of dangerous scientific tests constructed by a rogue A.I. named GLaDOS, who has seized control over the entire facility.  The underground chambers and empty rooms Chell now roams were once home to Aperture Science: a controversial, scientific research company that was known for experimental research in the areas of teleportation and portal technology. In a race for government funding, Aperture Science built GLaDOS with the intention of giving her control over testing new scientific technology. In an extreme case of science gone wrong, GLaDOS turns rogue upon activation, and murders most of the scientists and employees who worked there, allowing her to nestle into a comfortable technocratic dictatorship, where she wields ultimate control of the facility.  This movie also tells the story of Doug Rattmann, a former Aperture Science employee who was one of the very few to survive the deadly A.I. takeover of the facility, and whose fate would be intertwined with that of Chell. This movie is based on the Portal 2: Lab Rat comic released by the creators of Portal.
"Doug and GLaDOS" Original Concept Art by Nick Gonzalez
This concept piece illustrates the uncertainty of Doug regarding new A.I. technology being developed at Aperture Science.  Here we see GLaDOS spying on Doug from a far; foreshadowing the dangerous A.I. takeover Doug will experience but ultimately survive.
Concept and Design
The movie will contain robots, characters, items, and various elements from the game that will implemented into the story.  We have begun conceptualizing and designing these things already and will continue to do so.  Here are some examples.
"Rocket Turret" Original Concept Art by Mikhail Borulko
Here is a concept for a rocket turret we are planning to have in the movie. It is a blend of the earlier rocket turret from Portal and some new innovative designs to make it unique as well as to show the progression of GLaDOS's "scientific" inventions over time.
"Rocket Turret" Original Concept Art by Mikhail Borulko
The Portal 2: Lab Rat Comic
As mentioned earlier, Valve released a comic to tie in the narrative of Portal with its sequel, Portal 2, which we highly recommend reading.  The comic was a huge inspiration for us to make this movie because it opened up parts of the world of Portal never before seen, and allowed for a more expansive storyline with a slew of new characters and components of the story for us to work with.  The following are the first few pages of the comic, and then a link to see the rest.
Read the rest...
Aren't There Already Portal Fan Films Out There?  What Makes You So Different?
Many of the Portal fan films on YouTube are well made and entertaining, but they are mostly centered around the comedic side of Portal, with a sort of mockery of the serious aspect of the game. And when they are serious, they are just WAY too short, and have minimal dialogue and story.  While all this is fine, we think most Portal fans deep down long for a Portal movie, including us.  And while there have been talks among people like JJ Abrams and Gabe Newell about a big-budget Portal movie, the reality of one actually happening is still a ways off, or maybe even non-existent.  On top of that you will have to pay to see it.  With Portal: Lab Rat, we will deliver a cinematic, serious, and epic Portal movie, totally free to watch and enjoy.  
Here is a link to our YouTube channel where you can see our previous work, youtube.com/ColinandConnor (links to our films at the bottom of the page too).  We tend to be quite unique in the YouTube-sphere, not only with the cinematic look and feel of our content, but also the length.  Last Fall we released a 45-minute, action packed, zombie film based on Valve's Left 4 Dead game, which remains one of the longest fan films on YouTube, receiving fantastic reviews and close to 2 million views (pretty good for a 45 minute film on YouTube!), and we did it on a skeleton budget.  We are strong advocates of bringing professional-looking, cinematic content to YouTube, with great storytelling, which we strive to do with every film we make.  We fervently believe in quality over quantity, and with just a quick look at our YouTube channel, you will see we aren't joking.
What About Copyright?
We are not affiliated in any way with Portal or Valve (the creators of Portal) as this movie is 100% fan made and thus, made for fans!  However,  Valve strongly encourages their fans to create movies and other content using their material such as stories, characters, models, music, etc.  They have released several amazing tools to do so, one being Source Filmmaker.  To be clear, we are NOT selling the movie in any way; it will be uploaded to the internet where anyone can watch it for free.  Valve has an official policy when it comes to stuff like this so give it a read if you are unsure! Valve Video Policy

Where Can I Watch Portal: Lab Rat?
When finished, Portal: Lab Rat will be uploaded to our YouTube channel, youtube.com/ColinandConnor, where anyone and everyone can watch it in its entirety for FREE.  However, it will only be available on DVD/Blu-Ray or any other form through this Kickstarter so make sure you grab a copy!
Why We are Taking on this Project, and What We Hope to Accomplish
Playing Portal for the first time was really an incredible experience. It was one of the most unique, thought-provoking and terrifying games we have ever played. As filmmakers, we believe Portal has enormous potential as a serious film; one with an encompassing story that has heart and purpose which is always at the center of what we do.  We truly believe in and aspire to give the online community top-quality, cinematic content with great storytelling and a Portalfilm has always been one of our dream projects.  We really couldn't be more excited to start production on Portal: Lab Rat!
Where is My Money Going to?
That's a great question.  For a production of this scale, the money will go towards many things.  These essentials include: camera and equipment rentals, locations, custom props, set construction, actors, costuming, and visual effects.  Even the little things add up quickly, like production insurance, makeup, etc.  Portal is also intricately themed, meaning many of the things you will see in the movie will have to be custom produced.  All these things add up, but they make for a professional quality film.
Who Are We?
We are Colin and Connor McGuire, two brothers who write, direct and produce films together!  We previously wrote, directed and produced Left 4 Dead - The Movie, a 3-part movie totaling over an hour long, inspired and based on Valve's zombie game Left 4 Dead.  We uploaded Left 4 Dead - The Movie to our YouTube channel and since, the film has received over 16 million views worldwide.  We also run a YouTube channel, youtube.com/ColinandConnor, where we upload our films and where Portal: Lab Rat will be uploaded so be sure to check it out!  We currently have around 20 million views and 115,000 subscribers to our channel!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any production of this size, especially one placed in the Portal universe comes with a plethora of risks and challenges. However, we are prepared for anything that comes our way.

Many of the problems that arise on any production have to do with inefficient pre-production which we affirm to avoid with extensive planning, scheduling, and pre-visualization. We will be thoroughly dedicated to ensuring the integrity of our vision, and that it will hold up as a quality piece of entertainment. Some of these measures include, but are not limited to, storyboards, concept art, visual effects supervisors, script readings, rehearsals, etc. We remain insistent on delivering a movie both true to Portal and ourselves.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
In 2012, Apple changed their MagSafe port, and over night all power supplies became obsolete. For people on the go, that meant either buying all new MacBook chargers or carrying a tiny adapter that you'll lose the day after you buy it!
KeyBit is the solution.
KeyBit+ shown with red 3D printed cover

A few weeks ago I released a keychain to keep your MagSafe adapter from getting lost. Thanks to Shapeways steel 3D printing, I have been able to help many MacBook users avoid frustration. The response has been overwhelming and I want to make it even better!
The current process is slow, expensive, and inefficient. The packaging alone accounts for nearly half the cost! Currently, each order is printed individually. Imagine baking a single cookie every time somebody wanted one. (don't forget the milk :)
With an all new manufacturing process, I can offer a product that is sleek, polished, and coated in better materials that feel as good as it looks.
The production of a nicely milled steel piece is going to require about 8 weeks development time and possibly a couple more for production refinements.
I have already lined up distribution channels so getting it to you will be easier and quicker.
In addition, I have some great rewards for backers to help me start this new business.
Thanks for your support. Let's rock!
A special thanks to Taylor Sternberg for his wonderful video skills and dedication to helping me get Kickstarted.
:) Mockup of different KeyBit+ colors
$200 Backers:
For this reward, I will offer a google hangout class for those backers that want to learn from my process and bring their own idea to reality. Here is a quick breakdown of what that hangout class will entail.
1) Basic 3D modeling. (things to think about when working with volumes) I will go over some key items in helping you move from a napkin sketch to 3D model, and get you to think about forms and structures in general to turn that thinking into working prototypes.
2) Materials, properties, and what to expect from your print. Making something digitally that need to feel, flex, and behave a certain way is not easy. I will explain how I have researched materials, and taken advantage of material properties to create products that benefit directly from the material in use.
3) Learn from my mistakes and successes. This is not the first product I have prototyped in 3D, so I have definitely made mistakes and learned from them along the way. I can show some models that have and haven't worked in the past and what good practices are for a successful/working prototype.
4) Sending a model to print. I would love for you to print your very first shapeways print with me. If you are not familiar with any 3D modeling software, we will use the free Sketchup and send a model to shapeways to print.
5) Moving beyond prototypes. Is 3D printing the end goal? Probably not, so here is an overview of different prototype methods as well as manufacturing methods. They each have their pros and cons.
I don't plan to teach you how to use a piece of software, since software changes frequently, and I strongly believe learning is about the process and getting to be familiar with a new medium. I am excited to give a personal look into the process and share some valuable lessons I have learned along the way.  I look forward to sharing my experience and knowledge to help you join an exciting family of digital makers.
Rewards in the simplest form

updates.update_content:
Hi Kickstarters!
It's been a long while, and I wanted to reach out, since this year is going to be a busy and exciting year. I am scheduled to release a number of projects that I have been working on for a while.
Quiet launch, Loud landing

First of all Happy 2015!
To start off the new year, I'll bet you weren't expecting a brand new hand screen printed t-shirt. I know the wait has been long, so much so you probably expected that the t-shirt ship departed long ago, but as it has been on my mind, I wanted to make the shirts and make them right to properly say THANK YOU.
I have to assume that some of you have moved in the past year and a half, and so I have created a 30 second form for you to fill out and let me know where to send the shirt. I already have your shirt sizes, so no worries about that, they are packed and simply waiting to be address.

Hi Backers,
It has been nearly a year since my last update, and believe it or not, plenty has happened in that year. In March of this year, KeyBit went on sale on Amazon.com, being the quickest way to deliver as well as most affordable option for shipping. Fulfillment by Amazon means that a whole bunch of KeyBits get sent around the country so they can deliver within a single day to any location, and if you haven't seen their robots moving KeyBits around the warehouse, you should check it out. Okay, so you can't specifically see KeyBits in the video, but pretty amazing to see Santa's little helpers in action (surely someone else has given them that st. nickname :).

Why so silent?
(No, this is not a question about Gravity's soundtrack...) I know it has been a while since I last updated, and after my visit to the manufacturing facility, I was quite optimistic that I would have shipped by this next update. That is no reason for me to be stubborn and not send an update until I ship the product, but it did take some swallowing of dignity to sit down and write an update before I get to the one I am excited to write.

Hey backers,
I just got back from visiting SwissTurn USA, the manufacturer of the KeyBit, in their new facilities and I wanted to let you know that the production versions will be on the machines in the next few days, and a step closer to your door step :) I have been working closely with Andrew at SwissTurn to make the KeyBit, so it was great to put a face to the name, grab a bite, and get a tour of the final process.

Hey Backers!
It has been a while since my last update, and much has happened since the last, so I wanted to fill you in. First of all, the international shipments went out for all of the $30+ backers with the help of my good friend Taylor Sternberg. If you have not received the shipment by next week and you are a $30+ backer, please let me know.
I did want to clarify that the $15 and $20 rewards, the production version of the KeyBit and KeyBit+, has not shipped because it is currently in production. I will be sending out a survey for the rest of the backers once I have all of the components ready to ship. But until then I will send a couple more updates with production photos, and my experience with the process.

Stretch Goals!!
Shovel Knight keeps digging right through those stretch goals! Thank you! Keep up the support and let's hit our next goal soon!
Wait... What are Stretch Goals?
Stretch goals are extra content that we can accomplish if the funding goals are met. For instance, if we hit 200,000, then we will have enough resources to implement a 4 player battle mode! It’s not to say we will won’t see these features in the future some time (don’t be too worried! ), but if we reach the stretch goals, we can promise them with confidence! Here is a description of the stretch goals:
Music Player
Sound Test! Adds an in-game music player that lets you listen to all of your favorite Shovel Knight tunes. Collect song scrolls in the levels and take them to the bard, who will play them for you with perfect accuracy! We might even have some special, hidden songs... You’ll also be able to hear all the SFX samples, but we don’t know how the bard does that.
Achievements
We tend to like achievements because they change the way you play the game! This stretch goal will add a bevy of achievements to ALL VERSIONS of the game.  These aren’t just going to be stock achievements; they will be creative and wonderful. Can you beat Shovel Knight without losing a life? Prove it!
New Game Plus
Start the game over with your weapons and items fully upgraded. However… enemies are going to be tougher, resources more scarce, and new challenges may arise. With new game plus, it’s like a whole new game! Kind of! +!
Playable Boss Knight
Play the full game as a member of the Order of No Quarter! If we meet this stretch goal, we’ll hold a vote to see who it will be. Expect the game to play differently! For example, Propeller Knight could have the ability to hover for short distances, but would be a low health ‘glass cannon’ of sorts. Even the story and dialog will change a little bit to reflect the changes!
Linux / Mac Versions
Want to play Shovel Knight on your weirdo computer? Many folks have asked for Linux and Mac versions. We hope to support Mac and Linux either way, but this goal makes it happen for sure, and in a more timely fashion (hopefully in 2013!).
Gender Swap Mode!
We want Shovel Knight to be enjoyable by boys and girls of all ages, everywhere. With this mode, the main characters’ genders will be swapped, giving us a chance to do it before the internet has a chance to. The story will also change a bit to reflect the changes. Can you defeat the Evil Enchanter?
Challenge Mode
Adds a comprehensive batch of challenge rooms  to Shovel Knight. In this mode, Shovel Knight will be tasked with a variety of mini-quests like “defeat all the enemies!” or “reach the goal in time!”. Expect things like pacifism challenges and other rules-benders… and expect some tough-as-nails challenges too!
4 Player Battle Mode!*
We’ve talked a ton about multiplayer for Shovel Knight. While full-on multiplayer is out of the scope of this project, we could totally do 4 player couch co-op battles! Imagine playing as Shovel Knight ( or any of the extra playable knights ) and duking it out in the arena! Several modes would be ideal:
·         Cash collecting, where you fight for treasure that appears in the level. Knock your buddy to make gems fall out and collect them!
·         Racing, where all players would have to make their way to the end of a stage
·         Last man standing, where the only goal is to slash mercilessly… to the bitter end!
*This is couch co-op only, not online. We hope to bring this feature to all platforms, but the 3DS isn’t guaranteed because multiplayer is Wi-Fi only.
PHYSICAL.ACTUAL.REAL.BOX.
If we reach this stretch goal, then we will make a physical box of the game, which will be mailed free to backers pledging at the $50 tier and above! Plus, ALL backers will receive the digital version, to print or view at your leisure. NOTE: This box art is only a mockup. We might have a surprise or two for the final box art! Johnny Vila, your prayers have been answered :P
3rd Playable Boss Knight!
Call this goal unoriginal, but we don’t care. We’re too excited to play as another boss knight! Let’s get to this pledge level and have one more knight (who will be chosen by the community) make the cut! Rally! For the Order of No Quarter!
All Bosses Playable in Battle Mode!!
If we reach this goal, the entire Order of No Quarter (including the Enchantress herself!) will step into Battle Mode, for the ultimate battle royale. Wild new combat styles abound! Play as your under-appreciated favorite and beat up the more popular knights that got voted into the main campaign!
Shovel Knight is a sweeping classic action adventure game with awesome gameplay, memorable characters, and an 8-bit retro aesthetic. It's a hot mashup of new and old that may remind you of Mega Man, Castlevania, or Dark Souls! You play as the eponymous Shovel Knight, a small knight with a huge quest. Shovel Knight has come to this valley with two goals: to defeat the evil Enchantress and save his lost beloved. He wields a ShovelBlade: a multipurpose weapon whose techniques have now been lost to the ages. Always honest and helpful, Shovel Knight is a shining example of the code of Shovelry: Slash Mercilessly and Dig Tirelessly!
But, between Shovel Knight and his beloved stands a cadre of villainous knights. These terrible foes, known as The Order of No Quarter, have been dispatched to prevent Shovel Knight from reaching the Enchantress, and will pursue their mission at any cost.
If you love games with perfect platforming, beautiful art, infectious music, crazy bosses, and real heart… Shovel Knight is for you! If you don’t, then what? How could you not be into that stuff? Keep reading, you’ll come around!
Every great game needs a great set of baddies, and Shovel Knight’s are a doozy. Shovel Knight’s Nemesis is The Enchantress, a mysterious and powerful conjurer. Her Order of No Quarter has swept over the land, stationed in locations Shovel Knight is sure to visit. In order to get to the Enchantress, he’s gonna have to beat them all!
We love themed bosses and themed levels; this love is on full display in Shovel Knight! Each knight in the Order has been lovingly crafted to have a distinct look, theme, and personality. These epic boss battles are really going to shine! We already love our villainous bunch, so let us share them with you.
This is Polar Knight: the Sabretooth to Shovel Knight’s Wolverine. He’s guarding a stranded ship in the frozen south. Titanic and terrible, he is the largest and most brutish of the Order of No Quarter. Some time in the past, Shovel Knight and Polar Knight have crossed Shovels before...
• Pros: Wields Snow Shovel, Doesn't feel cold but is quite considerate!
• Cons: Annoying laugh ( it's like water torture )!
And Propeller Knight! He commands the Enchantress' flying machine with the cocksure attitude of a sky pirate! With his Heli-Helmet, he can zoom short distances with ease. Shovel Knight encounters Propeller Knight on top of the aircraft as it zooms through the sky; earth fights against air in a true battle of elements!
• Pros: Talented Fencer, Mechanical Heli-Helmet, Debonair!
• Cons: Arrogance, Lightweight, Outrageous Accent!
Sometimes, the bomb is mightier than the sword. Deep in the recesses of his alchemical lab, Plague Knight perfects concoctions both poisonous and explosive. Toxin, disease, and death are his playgrounds. Even his comrades give Plague Knight a wide berth, because he spreads more than just the common cold. With an array of mysterious and magical bottles at his side, Plague Knight could be considered the black sheep of The Order of No Quarter.
Pros: Maniacal scientific mind, fearlessness bordering on recklessness
Cons: Physically weak, short stature, shy at parties
Mole Knight... the shovel may rule the confines of man-made gardens, but in the wild, the titan of tunneling is the mole! Mole Knight embraces this truth wholeheartedly. With his modified drop-forged armored claws, he mockingly tears through the earth with brute strength! Mole Knight calls the subterranean Lost City his home... an ancient abandoned metropolis. Shovel Knight must pass through the Lost City, but chances are slim he won’t be challenged to see who is truly the master of digging.
Pros: Great eyesight, shrewd, high endurance
Cons: Obsessive personality, gets sweaty in armor
Tinker Knight! Some knights love rushing into the glory of battle, ready to crush the skulls of their enemies! Tinker Knight is not one of those knights. He does his fighting before the battle begins, laboring on diabolical devices that do his work for him. The wrench is the tool of his trade, doubling as an engineering device and a melee weapon. Some are quick to dismiss Tinker Knight’s lethality... usually just before falling victim to one of his mechanical monstrosities!
Pros: Gregarious demeanor, hard worker
Cons: Rough hands, works long hours, always out to prove himself
We’re going to be sharing more of the Order of No Quarter as the Kickstarter proceeds, so check in often!
Shovel Knight is rendered in a pumped-up 8-bit style. We are adhering to the NES color palette, but adding many modern touches. For example, We have tons of scrolling background layers, giving a real illusion of depth.
Our pixel animation and attention to detail is top-notch. Every character, even minor foes like these wizards, have painstakingly crafted animations and personalities.
Detailed, living backgrounds and animation! Big, beautiful pixels! Just look at the screens!! With Shovel Knight, we are developing a next-gen 8 bit game!
Like all of our favorite games, Shovel Knight has been designed gameplay first! We are especially dedicated to precise control. Pixel-perfect hit boxes, toenail jumps, and mobility mastery are our obsession. That wonderfully elusive 'feel' of great control.
When thinking of the initial concept, we started by saying “what if we built a whole game around a downward sword thrust? It would be great to sink into dirt, attack foes by stabbing from above, and maybe even bounce on hard ground! Ok, digging as a major mechanic… how about it’s a shovel instead of a sword? That way, we can have him use the flat blade of the spade to flip things over and slash!”
From that gameplay concept sprung all of the ideas for Shovel Knight. We've learned from games like Mother 3 that a game becomes much stronger when graphics, story and tone work together to unify the gameplay experience!
Great music is central to great games, so it’s with incredible excitement that we can announce that Jake “Virt” Kaufman is composing the soundtrack for Shovel Knight! For those of you who don’t know, Jake is one of the most talented audio guys in the game biz, contributing on games from Mighty Switch Force to Contra 4 to Shantae. His most recent work on Double Dragon Neon has garnered as much praise as the game itself!
Nugget love
True to our sense of collaboration, our team likes to involve audio early and often in development. For Shovel Knight’s music, we’re taking an NES+ style approach, adding sound channels and detail for a fuller sound that’s still authentic. In addition to the main theme highlighted in the trailer, check out the track written for Pridemoor Keep, the level we’ll be debuting at PAX!
If you liked that, you should just go listen to everything on his website (virt.bandcamp.com) because it’s amazing. And check out the Official Shovel Knight Soundtrack Album backer reward below! WE LOVE JAKE! 
Yacht Club Games is an independent game developer started in 2011 by Sean Velasco and a crew from WayForward. We are a fun-loving bunch of gaming geniuses who have dedicated our lives to video games ever since we saw our first pixels. However, our serious and solemn goal is to make really awesome original games that fuse modern and retro sensibilities, and we have the pedigree to prove it! Our team is comprised of top talent that has worked on some amazing titles, including Contra 4, A Boy and His Blob, Thor: God of Thunder, Mighty Milky Way, BloodRayne Betrayal, and most recently, Double Dragon Neon.This is our maiden project as Yacht Club Games, which means we are determined to impress.
So what are we all about? We want to create fun and challenging gameplay. We want to both tug at your heartstrings and delight you with levity and charm. We want to make games that you play together with friends and family. Most of all, we want to give everyone the same collective types of game experiences that have defined our generation. It’s such an exciting time to be a fan of games; the industry is experiencing a renaissance and creativity is flourishing. We are so, so excited to develop games that we love, in hopes that you love them too!
Shovel Knight is currently nearing the end of preproduction. This means that the game design has been written, the main character designs and story have been created, and we have a plan for moving forward. We have an early build of the game that proves out our game mechanics and technology; you can see some footage in the trailer and we'll also be at PAX East!
However, many things are still up in the air. Enemies and objects need to be designed and drawn. Audio, Animation, and Backgrounds need to be crafted. Lastly, we need to polish everything to a mirror sheen. Basically, we have what you saw in the video. Now we need to make the whole game.
So, we think this is a great time in the process to involve the community. We have a skeleton to build on, but we want you to be the meat!
Video games are expensive and time-consuming to develop, so the usual way to get one made is to acquire funding from a publisher. We have had great partnerships with publishers in the past. However, working with a publisher has its drawbacks; you are beholden to them, and they are generally risk averse. We wanted to go to the community, because Kickstarter provides us a unique opportunity to interface directly with our fans and make a game where fun and quality are always the top priorities.
We believe in Shovel Knight. We know that the final game is going to be great. We’re so sure of this that we quit our full time jobs to work on it. We’ve poured a massive amount of time, money and effort into our labor of love, but it’s not enough to finish the game. In order to make Shovel Knight a reality, we need you!
We have amazing rewards that we are as excited to give out as we are to make! Check ‘em out below!
The Game!
Get a digital PC copy ( PC, LINUX, MAC, STEAM ) of Shovel Knight, hot off the digital presses! Digital!
Also, ALL pledge levels $15 and above will be able to choose on which platform they want their stalwart blue hero!!!
Instruction Booklet
The final Instruction book will have illustrations, not sketches!
Ah, the Instruction Booklet… the comfort food of books. We still have a few of our favorites, the pages worn and cramped with notes. Together with you, we can bring the lost art of instruction booklets back to the limelight! The Shovel Knight Instruction Booklet is full of important safety information, awesome character art, enemy lists, hints, and space for notes. We are taking the utmost care to make sure that these booklets are true to their predecessors, right down to the way they smell.
We want the kids of today to feel the excitement of reading the booklet in eager anticipation of the game’s release, so we are going to send you the booklet FIRST, so you can read it and reread it, and go crazy with anticipation!
Shovel Knight Coffee Table Book
This is a Book of the Game! The goal is to make something fun and funny, an entertaining compendium of the whole Shovel Knight production. Design Discussions and sketches! Concept Art and Illustrations! Game Maps, pixel animation sequences, and work-in-progress versions of everything! As we develop Shovel Knight, we’ll be chronicling the process and we want to put it all here on display. As a crazy indie startup, you know there is going to be a lot of juicy stuff!
Shovel Knight Official Soundtrack
We already told you how awesome Jake Kaufman's music is. Hopefully you are thinking that Shovel Knight is looking pretty awesome too. Well, now you can own the combined awesome with this pressing of the Official Shovel Knight Soundtrack! Laid delicately into a bejeweled case, this CD and accompanying liner notes will be adorned lovingly with customized art. This is what you want. It’s what we want! It’s what we all want!!
Official Shovel Knight Dirt Signed by The Yacht Club
This is the best product photo ever, bwahaha!
Own a real piece of the Shovel Knight Saga! At this reward level, we will hand-sign and deliver a handsome, wax-sealed envelope filled with Official Shovel Knight Dirt. We have obtained dirt ( at no small expense, mind you! ) from each area of Shovel Knight’s Kingdom; Gearwork Dirt from the base of the Clockwork Tower, Besmirched Dirt from the Village of Plague, and more! The dirt you receive will be chosen at random, but trust us when we say that all of the dirt is very special. Get it fast, because when it runs out, it’s gone. We’re not made out of dirt here!
Design Hangouts
Now you can take part in our design process! We will be broadcasting on a private video channel available only to our beloved Kickstarter backers! You can be a fly on the wall and listen to us as we hash out the finer details of the design and work through problems, or you can jump in and tell us what to do! There is no guarantee we will listen, but many can attest to our receptiveness to ridiculous ideas. Budding game designers, armchair directors, and trolls can all have lots of fun!
Original Concept Art / Game Design Card
Super Design Index Cards!
The Yacht Club loves index cards: we use them to quickly communicate ideas! Puzzle setups, boss patterns, and sketches of new enemies; they are hastily scribbled onto cards and passed around! It’s completely awesome, and it also means that by the end of a project, we have a lot of really cool index cards lying around. We are going to send you an original one of these cards! You can specify if you want a design card or an art card. Maybe you’ll get the very first sketch of an enemy that's in the final game!
Your Likeness In the Game
Appease your ego by having us painstakingly hand-craft a pixel version of you, which will appear somewhere in Shovel Knight. Send us a photo and we will recreate you in 8-bits and immortalize you forever… but where will you appear in the game? We know where we are going to put you, but it’s a secret for now!
SuperDeluxe Canvas Poster Signed by The Yacht Club
This is a really super high-quality 24x36 poster, signed by the team and sent to you. Suitable for framing ( you had better frame it! ), this poster will feature the classiest art we have by the end of the project.
Director For A Day!!
As Director for a day, you will get to design a major character, boss, midboss, or scenario. We’ll take you through the whole process from conception to completion, helping massage your design into the game with probably hilarious results! Check out the details below! NOTE: ( Actual implementation time may be longer than one day )
Yacht Club Sleepover!
Come to sunny Southern California ( or if you are already here, just drive over to us ) to meet and spend the day with the Yacht Club! We’ll do a studio tour, get a fancy meal (or drive-through if you don’t have a collared shirt, but you can order whatever you want and we'll get like a whole extra bag of hot sauce), and then go back and play games for as long as we can stay up! Maybe we could also wear our jammies and talk about who we have a crush on! Oh, or if you would rather not, that’s ok too… we’ll take our cues from you I guess.
Yacht Party with the Yacht Club
If there is anything the Yacht Club loves as much as making games, it’s partying hard to celebrate a game launch. At this reward level, you will join us in SoCal with other Yacht Club superfriends on an hours-long voyage in celebration of Shovel Knight’s release! All of this is going to be on a Real Yacht on the Real Ocean, which we will be renting for the occasion ( the yacht, not the ocean ).
Listen as we regale you with tales of the game dev trenches! Stumble about as you try to get your sea legs! Sing karaoke and be merry, because tonight, my friend, we are all superstars!
Did I mention our special musical guest Jake “Virt” Kaufman, who is going to play live?
It’s gonna be epic as hell. You should totally come.
Follow us on Facebook! If you'd like to support us, liking and sharing us would be very appreciated!
Follow us on Twitter! We always have something dumb to say!
Watch our YouTubes! New videos and other excitement will be posted here.
Help us get on Steam! We need your votes!
Lastly, if you want to reach out to us for ANYTHING, hit us up at: kickstarter@yachtclubgames.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Making great video games is hard. Like, really hard! Art, design, and technology have to be blended seamlessly to create a cohesive experience. On top of that, it takes time to iterate and expand on ideas. There is a reason lots of awesome games take forever to come out!
 The biggest risk is that Shovel Knight would take longer than anticipated. If production were to go late, cash would be the biggest problem. If catastrophe truly struck, our backup plan would be to pool our remaining funds and partner with venture capitalist or publisher to get the game done. This game is our livelihood, so we will do whatever it takes!
 However, perish the thought of failure! Yacht Club Games has an experienced staff that has shipped more than 30 projects on more than 8 platforms. We work as a team, we have made games of this type before, and we know what we are doing!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shovel Knight: Treasure Trove Is Complete!
updates.update_content: Salutations, original true believers! It may have seemed like it would never come, but today is the day. Shovel Knight: King of Cards and Shovel Knight Showdown are out now! This momentous occasion marks the completion of Shovel Knight: Treasure Trove. The long, 6 year development journey began with the Shovel Knight Kickstarter in 2013, followed by 4 more games: Plague of Shadows in 2015, Specter of Torment in 2017, and now King of Cards and Shovel Knight Showdown in 2019. It’s all finally done!

Multiple years in the making! After so  much hard work and eager anticipation on everyone’s part, we are excited  to formally unveil the release date…
December 10th, 2019

updates.update_content: It’s a big day for the world of Shovel Knight! We’re so excited to raise the curtains and update everyone with what we’ve been working on!
